0.title: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' was acting masterclass with Ranveer: Shalini
0.article_body: Actress Shalini Pandey, who will make her Bollywood debut with 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar', shared a still from the film on social media, writing that it was like an acting masterclass with Ranveer Singh. The actress called him "a giant of an actor", adding that she calls him Guruji. "I love this picture...it describes our bond, a natural connection...we formed," Shalini wrote.

1.title: There's lot of noise outside but it doesn't affect me: MI pacer Bumrah
1.article_body: MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah said he knows there's a lot of "noise outside" about his form in ongoing IPL but it doesn't affect him. "Because I'm not a person who judges my performance on what others think or what...experts are saying," he added. Bumrah, who took his maiden fifer in IPL on Monday, has taken 10 wickets from 11 matches.

2.title: I left him confused sometimes: Ex-Real Madrid keeper López on Messi
2.article_body: Ex-Real Madrid goalkeeper Diego López said he managed to confuse former Barcelona forward Lionel Messi sometimes. "The best players I have had in front of me over the years are Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi. I was lucky enough to be Cristiano’s partner for two years," added López. López is the first goalkeeper to save two penalties by the Argentine.

3.title: 'Monster quake' occurs on Mars; 'biggest ever on another planet', says NASA
3.article_body: NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory has detected a magnitude 5 "monster quake" on Mars, which it said was "the biggest ever detected on another planet". The tremblor occurred on May 4, 2022, which was the 1,222nd Martian day of the mission involving NASA's InSight Mars lander. On Earth, the tremor would have been considered medium-sized, NASA said.

4.title: Ex-CEC Sunil Arora joins agri-tech startup as non-executive chairman
4.article_body: The former Chief Election Commissioner of India Sunil Arora has joined agri-tech startup 'Gram Unnati' as its new non-executive chairman. Founded in 2013 by IIT-Kharagpur graduate Aneesh Jain, Gram Unnati provides advisory services and access to quality inputs at low costs among other things. Prior to this, Arora has also served in the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship.

5.title: Women dance on vulgar songs with goddess', PM's images in background at MP event
5.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government has suspended Mandsaur's chief municipal officer after videos showing women dancing on vulgar songs with a goddess' image in background at an event surfaced on social media. Pictures of PM Narendra Modi and other leaders were also seen on the banner in the background. State minister Hardeep Singh Dang had demanded action against chief municipal officer.

6.title: Sonu Sood asks for 50 liver transplants worth ₹12 crore as fees to promote a hospital
6.article_body: Sonu Sood, speaking to The Man magazine, recalled how he gave the money from his last few endorsements to charity. Citing an example, he said, "A gentleman...from Aster Hospitals connected with me...and said the group would like to collaborate with me...I said that I'll promote the hospitals, but give me 50 liver transplants. That's almost ₹12 crore in value."

7.title: Bumrah shares pic of match ball after posting his best figures in T20 cricket
7.article_body: MI fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah took to Instagram to share a picture of the match ball after he recorded his best figures in T20 cricket. Bumrah, who registered figures of 4-1-10-5 against KKR on Monday, wrote, "Disappointed with last night's result but a memorable evening nevertheless." It was Bumrah's first-ever five-wicket haul in T20 cricket.

8.title: BJP created 2 Indias, Cong will form next govt in Gujarat: Rahul
8.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has accused BJP of creating "two Indias" at a rally in Dahod, Gujarat. "One for the rich and one for the poor, resources of the country belonging to poor people are being given to a few rich people," Gandhi said. The 51-year-old politician also claimed that Congress will form the next government in Gujarat.

9.title: Sri Lanka's ex-PM flees to naval base with family amid violent protests: Reports
9.article_body: Sri Lanka's former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and his family members have reportedly taken shelter at a naval base after violent protests erupted all over the country, amid its worst economic crisis. The Rajapaksas are putting up at Trincomalee Naval Base after fleeing their official residence in Colombo, reports said. Videos showed protests underway in front of the naval base.

10.title: Depp, team celebrate as Heard claims he pushed Kate Moss down stairs
10.article_body: A video shows Johnny Depp and his legal team celebrating after his ex-wife Amber Heard testified he pushed supermodel Kate Moss down the stairs. Heard was testifying in the ongoing defamation trial against her and recounted the first incident she hit Depp which involved her sister. Heard had earlier claimed that people told her Depp pushed Kate down the stairs.

11.title: Does he say the same about Rohit: Hayden on Shastri's 'Kohli needs a break' remark
11.article_body: Talking about Ravi Shastri saying that Virat Kohli needs a break amid his bad form, cricketer-turned-commentator Matthew Hayden said, "Does he say the same about Rohit Sharma? I mean these guys are playing cricket all the time." He added, "No player ever believes that they can go to the selector and go, 'Sorry, I need to be out'."

12.title: Sharp fall in tech stocks crazy, feels like dot-com boom: Zerodha CEO
12.article_body: Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath on Tuesday tweeted, "The sharp fall in the stock prices of high growth tech companies across the globe is getting crazy, feels like the dot-com boom." He added, "India has weathered the storm mostly because not many such companies are listed & many private ones raised a lot of money last year."

13.title: India's 3 most profitable unicorns are entirely owned by promoters: Report
13.article_body: India's three most profitable unicorns have no venture capital or private equity investors and are entirely owned by promoters or promoter groups, Moneycontrol reported. Zoho Corporation, Zerodha and Mu Sigma are the most profitable Indian unicorns, Moneycontrol added. While Zoho and Zerodha are bootstrapped, Mu Sigma was backed by venture capital firms before its founder bought back their shares.

14.title: Have tradition for newlyweds in our football team: Abhishek on Ranbir
14.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan, who led the All Stars Football Club against Emirates United in Dubai, said it was a special match for them as it was Ranbir Kapoor's first match after getting married. He revealed they have a tradition for the newlyweds. "They're going to put me in front of...goal...I'm going to kick lots of balls at them," Ranbir responded.

15.title: Chinese cargo spacecraft docks with its 1st space station's module
15.article_body: An unmanned Chinese cargo spacecraft successfully docked with an orbiting space station module on Tuesday, completing the sixth of 11 missions needed to finish building China's first space station by year-end. The spacecraft transported propellants, application experiments samples, some payloads and supplies for three astronauts. Three astronauts will travel to Tianhe in June for a six-month stay.

16.title: Woman stabbed to death by live-in partner after argument in Delhi
16.article_body: A 19-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed to death by her live-in partner after an argument in South Delhi's Mehrauli area on Monday. Police have arrested the accused and recovered a knife from his possession. According to the police, the accused said that he had been unemployed for the last one year, due to which they both fought often over expenses.

17.title: Will make sure AFSPA is removed from all areas in Assam: Amit Shah
17.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said efforts would be made to ensure that the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA) is withdrawn from the entire Assam. Earlier, AFSPA was lifted from 23 districts entirely and one district partially in the state. "The day is not far when there won't be even one insurgent outfit in Assam," said Shah.

18.title: Nepalese doctor abducted from UP rescued in Bihar after 10 days
18.article_body: A Nepalese doctor, who was abducted from Uttar Pradesh 10 days ago, has been rescued from Bihar's West Champaran district. He was held captive for a ransom of ₹3 lakh. The accused took him to different locations namely Yogapatti near Lauriya, Pathkauli and Malakauli and tortured him, police said, adding that two accused have been arrested.

19.title: 27 flights cancelled at Andhra's Visakhapatnam Airport due to Cyclone Asani
19.article_body: Flight operations at Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam Airport were severely affected as several flights were cancelled due to the severe cyclonic storm Asani in the Bay of Bengal. Airport Director K Srinivasa Rao said IndiGo has cancelled 23 flights, including both arrivals and departures, citing bad weather. "Four AirAsia flights also stand cancelled due to bad weather at Vizag," he added.

20.title: Shanghai sanitises homes of COVID-infected, shuts all subway lines
20.article_body: The Shanghai administration has started a sanitisation drive under which homes of people infected with COVID-19 are being sanitised using disinfectant sprays. On people's concern about damage to clothes and valuable items, a city official said the residents can inform the teams about items that need protection. The last two operational subway lines in the city have also been suspended.

21.title: Wasps foil suicide bid by woman in Kerala's Alappuzha
21.article_body: Wasps spoiled a woman's suicide attempt in Kerala's Alappuzha on Monday. The woman was climbing a mobile tower and threatened to jump if her husband didn't return her baby. While climbing, she disturbed a nest of wasps, who then swarmed around her and stung her. She rapidly climbed down and jumped when she was a few feet off the ground.

22.title: 14 Punjab policemen booked in Rajasthan on kidnapping charges
22.article_body: Rajasthan Police lodged an FIR against 14 Punjab policemen, including a Deputy Superintendent of Police and a Station House Officer, on kidnapping charges. A 21-year-old man from Boondi was abducted by Punjab Police from a hotel in Kota in March, the FIR states. This comes after Delhi Police booked Punjab Police personnel for the kidnapping of BJP's Tajinder Singh Bagga.

23.title: 16-yr-old boy beaten for theft, sets vehicles on fire in Pune; ₹19 lakh-damage caused
23.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was detained by Pune's Yerawada police after he set fire to vehicles at a housing society's parking lot and caused damage worth ₹19 lakh. The teenager was reportedly enraged as the society's residents had thrashed him after he was caught stealing petrol, police said. A police officer said that the act was caught on a CCTV camera.

24.title: Hindu groups protest near Qutub Minar, demand it be renamed Vishnu Stambh
24.article_body: Hindu groups like United Hindu Front (UHF) and Mahakal Manav Sewa held a protest near the Qutub Minar in Delhi on Tuesday, demanding that the minaret be renamed as Vishnu Stambh. The groups also recited Hanuman Chalisa near the Qutub Minar. A heavy police force has been deployed outside Qutub Minar.

25.title: They lost the only match played as a unit: Ajay Jadeja on GT's loss vs MI
25.article_body: Sharing his opinion on GT's loss against MI by five runs, ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said, "The fact is that they lost the only match in which they played as a unit." "GT looked solid from the start but the match slipped at the very end," added Ajay. GT's loss against MI was their second consecutive defeat in IPL 2022.

26.title: Our cultural world is poorer: PM on Pandit Shivkumar Sharma's demise
26.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday took to Twitter to condole the demise of Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma. He wrote, "Our cultural world is poorer...He popularised the Santoor at a global level. His music will continue to enthral the coming generations. Condolences to his family and admirers. Om Shanti." Pandit Shivkumar passed away due to cardiac arrest aged 84.

27.title: Pune woman molested, cheated of ₹50,000 by man she met on dating app
27.article_body: A woman in Pune was allegedly molested and defrauded of ₹50,000 by a man she met on a dating application. According to police, the accused first reached out to the woman in March and then harassed her by seeking sexual favours. The man also sought the amount from the woman on the pretext of expenditure for a vacation to Maldives.

28.title: Swiggy temporarily shuts Genie in Bengaluru, Mumbai due to staff shortage
28.article_body: Swiggy has temporarily shut down its pick-and-drop service Genie in major metro cities including Bengaluru, Hyderabad and Mumbai due to a shortage of workforce and inability to keep up with the demand. According to experts, Genie contributed around 5% to Swiggy’s overall business. The service has reportedly been unavailable in the mentioned areas for the past seven days.

29.title: Ranveer's 'Cirkus' to release on Dec 23, will clash with Tiger's 'Ganapath'
29.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty took to Instagram to announce the release date of his forthcoming project 'Cirkus'. The comedy-drama, starring Ranveer Singh, Pooja Hegde and Jacqueline Fernandez among others, will hit the theatres on December 23, 2022. 'Cirkus' will now clash with Tiger Shroff and Kriti Sanon-starrer action film 'Ganapath', which is being directed by Vikas Bahl.

30.title: PM Modi created 2 Indias, one for rich and one for poor: Rahul
30.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said PM Narendra Modi has created two Indias, one for the rich and another for the poor. He added that the country's resources are being given to a few wealthy people. In the BJP model, resources like water and land, which belong to tribals and other poor people, are being given to a few, he said.

31.title: Neighbour sets woman on fire 2 days before her wedding in Gurugram
31.article_body: A 24-year-old woman in Gurugram suffered 40% burn injuries after she was allegedly set on fire by her neighbour on Monday, two days before her wedding, said police. The victim's father said she was sleeping on their house's terrace when the accused poured petrol on her. He has also alleged that the accused used to pass remarks at his daughter.

32.title: Thane police constable rapes woman on pretext of helping her resolve problems
32.article_body: A police constable has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman under the pretext of helping her resolve her problems in Thane. The constable, who was posted at a police station, where the woman had come to lodge a complaint, befriended her. Police claimed the accused allegedly called her to different places and raped her on various occasions.

33.title: Vivek Agnihotri asks Tharoor if his late wife was Kashmiri Hindu, MP replies
33.article_body: After Vivek Agnihotri asked Shashi Tharoor if Sunanda Pushkar was a Kashmiri Hindu over his 'Singapore banned The Kashmir Files' tweet, the MP said dragging his late wife into the matter was unwarranted. Tharoor tweeted, "One thing I know, unlike those attempting to exploit her when she is not around to speak for herself: She believed in reconciliation, not hate."

34.title: 4 warehouse staffers steal 23,000 wheat bags worth ₹2 cr in Punjab
34.article_body: Four employees of a warehouse were booked on Monday for allegedly siphoning off 23,000 wheat bags worth over ₹2 crore in Punjab's Faridkot. The staffers had claimed that wheat bags were gutted during a fire, however, an investigation report stated that the fire was "put on by the employees intentionally for their personal benefit". The fire occurred earlier this month.

35.title: Russia fires barrage of hypersonic missiles at Ukraine's Odesa
35.article_body: The Russian forces reportedly struck Ukraine's Odesa with a barrage of hypersonic missiles. According to the Ukrainian military, the Russians fired seven missiles from the air which hit a shopping centre and a warehouse. It said that one person was killed while five others were injured in the attack. Ukrainian firefighters doused the fire caused by the strikes.

36.title: JSW Group will make a $7 billion bid for Ambuja Cements, ACC: Chairman
36.article_body: JSW Group's Chairman Sajjan Jindal told Financial Times that the steel-to-energy conglomerate will make a $7 billion bid for Holcim's India subsidiaries Ambuja Cements and ACC. JSW will offer $4.5 billion in its own equity and $2.5 billion from undisclosed private equity partners for the bid. It was earlier reported that Adani Group is in talks to acquire Holcim's assets.

37.title: Sharmila Tagore to make acting comeback after 12 years with 'Gulmohar'
37.article_body: Veteran actress Sharmila Tagore is set to make an acting comeback with a film titled 'Gulmohar'. The actress, who was last seen in the 2010 romantic-comedy 'Break Ke Baad', said, "After a considerable gap, I am very happy to be in the familiar and well-loved ambience of a film set." 'Gulmohar' also stars Manoj Bajpayee and Suraj Sharma.

38.title: Show us sex determination scene or we won't permit it: Delhi HC on 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'
38.article_body: Delhi High Court asked the producers of the upcoming Ranveer Singh starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' to show it a scene in the movie depicting prenatal sex-determination. "We'll have to see or we'll have to stay. Unless we see for ourselves, we'll not permit this," the court said. "Don't trivialise it to show...anybody can walk into...clinic and get it done," it added.

39.title: Office as we know it, is over: Airbnb CEO on letting staff work remotely forever
39.article_body: After Airbnb allowed its employees to work remotely forever, the company's CEO Brian Chesky said, "I think that the office as we know it, is over." He added, "We can't try to hold on to 2019 any more than 1950. We have to move forward." Chesky questioned whether the office would be invented today if it didn't already exist.

40.title: Anupam Kher meets Deepika Padukone at Dubai airport, shares pics
40.article_body: Anupam Kher on Tuesday shared pictures with actress Deepika Padukone on social media after running into her at Dubai airport. He wrote in the caption, "She being a alumni of @actorprepares her success graph makes me doubly happy and proud!" Actor Prepares is Anupam Kher's acting institute which has also trained actors like Hrithik Roshan, Varun Dhawan and Kiara Advani.

41.title: Tamil Nadu to probe reason for 3,000 students skipping board exams
41.article_body: The Tamil Nadu School Education Department has ordered a probe to look into the reason for over 3,000 students missing out on this year's state board exams. According to the official figures, 2,265 and 1,238 students were absent for Class 10 and Class 12 board examinations respectively. Notably, this year's dropout rate is higher than previous years, an official said.

42.title: Meta considers reducing money it gives news firms: Report
42.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta is considering reducing what it pays to news organisations as it reevaluates its partnerships formed in the last few years, The Information reported citing sources. The firm has seen a drop in users clicking on links to news articles since former US President Donald Trump left office. Meta earlier said it was slowing the growth of its workforce.

43.title: Musk's $44 bn Twitter deal at risk of being repriced lower, warns short-seller
43.article_body: Elon Musk's $44 billion offer to buy Twitter could get repriced lower if he walked away from the deal, short-seller Hindenburg Research warned on Monday. "Musk holds all the cards here," Hindenburg, which has a short position on Twitter, said. "If Musk's bid for Twitter disappeared tomorrow, Twitter's equity would fall by 50% from current levels," it added.

44.title: Where's edit button?: Musk's mom after mistake in her tweet about Taj Mahal
44.article_body: Maye Musk, the mother of the world's richest man Elon Musk who is buying Twitter, took to Twitter to share a picture from her Taj Mahal visit. "I went to the Taj Mahal in 2007...It is beautiful," she tweeted, however, she later tweeted, "Not 2007, 2012. Where is that edit button?" Earlier, Twitter confirmed it's working on an edit button.

45.title: Important for Umran to stay away from distractions: VVS Laxman
45.article_body: Former India batter VVS Laxman has said that SRH pacer Umran Malik needs to continue maintaining his focus and importantly stay away from distractions. "Soon you realise that you have to control your actions (off the field). There will be so many advisors...but players...very soon cordon all that off and focus on what is to be done," Laxman said.

46.title: Some bats pretend to be bees to scare off predators: Research
46.article_body: While studying how mouse-eared bats deal with other animals, researchers observed they buzzed like hornets or bees, possibly, in an attempt to push back potential predators. When buzzing sounds were played on speakers, bat predators were seen moving away in contrast to speakers that played non-buzzing sounds. This is the first time a mammal was found mimicking an insect.

47.title: Allahabad HC denies bail to 4 accused in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri case
47.article_body: Allahabad High Court on Monday rejected bail pleas of four accused in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri case. "These accused belong to very influential political families...apprehension of the prosecution that they would interfere with the course of justice...cannot be ruled out at this stage," HC said. The court will hear Union Minister Ajay Mishra's son Ashish Mishra's bail plea on May 25.

48.title: FIFA asks Brazil, Argentina to play abandoned WC qualifier again
48.article_body: Argentina and Brazil have been asked by FIFA to replay their 2022 World Cup qualifier, which was abandoned due to the alleged breach of COVID-19 protocols by the Argentinian side in September 2021. Both teams have qualified for the World Cup in Qatar, with Brazil topping the South American zone qualifying standings and Argentina finishing second.

49.title: Lovlina Borgohain starts with a win at the World Boxing Championships
49.article_body: Indian boxer Lovlina Borgohain won her first bout at the 12th IBA Women's World Boxing Championships. The 24-year-old boxer defeated the Chinese Taipei boxer and former world champion, Chen Nien-Chin, by 3-2 in the 70kg category event. Notably, Borgohain will now meet England's Cindy Ngamba in the 'Round of 16' match on Friday.

50.title: AAP govt in Punjab harmful for state's security: Cong's Jaiveer
50.article_body: Following a blast at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali, Congress leader Jaiveer Shergill said the AAP government in Punjab is "harmful" for the state's security. "I urge Union Home Minister Amit Shah to engage central probe agencies in the matter as AAP government is not capable to handle, nor does it have the right intent," Shergill added.

51.title: Mumbai-based Skillmatics raises $16 mn in Series B led by Sofina
51.article_body: Mumbai-based D2C educational games and resource brand Skillmatics has raised $16 million in its latest funding round led by Sofina Ventures. The funding round also saw participation from existing investors Sequoia Capital India and Jalaj Dani Family Office. Founded by Dhvanil Sheth and Devanshi Kejriwal, Skillmatics designs content-led games and play centric learning resources.

52.title: Only way to experience independence is through education: NASA scientist
52.article_body: The only way to experience true independence and empowerment is through education, an Indian-origin Program Scientist at NASA, Dr Hashima Hasan, said. "Get an education, build your confidence and stand on your own feet," she said while addressing the 7th annual Tehrim Dass Memorial Lecture at the Avadh Girls’ Degree College (AGDC) Lucknow.

53.title: Show some sensitivity towards Kashmiri Pandits for Sunanda's sake: Anupam to Tharoor
53.article_body: After Shashi Tharoor tweeted that Singapore has banned 'The Kashmir Files', actor Anupam Kher tweeted, "Dear Shashi Tharoor! Your callousness towards Kashmiri Hindus' genocide is tragic." Kher added, "If nothing else at least for Sunanda's sake who was a Kashmiri herself, you should show some sensitivity towards Kashmiri Pandits and not feel victorious about a country banning The Kashmir Files!"

54.title: Police raid rave party in B'luru, seize drugs worth ₹3 lakh; 33 held
54.article_body: Bengaluru Police raided a rave party at Otto's gastropub on the Old Airport Road and detained 33 people, including two organisers for allegedly selling and consuming drugs on Sunday. They seized multiple drugs, including MDMA, ecstasy pills, charas and ganja worth around ₹3 lakh from the venue. The attendees reportedly included students, IT firm employees and businessmen among others.

55.title: School athletes mistakenly given sanitiser to drink during race in Japan
55.article_body: Authorities of a Japanese school mistakenly gave sanitisers in cups instead of water to athletes during a race. They accidentally used the sanitiser that was stored in an unlabelled plastic bottle next to drinking water. While one athlete collapsed, vomited and dropped out of the race, a total of three of them were taken to the hospital.

56.title: I was dropped for a couple of games, it's been a tough period: Venkatesh
56.article_body: KKR all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer said it has been a tough period for him having been dropped for a few games by the franchise. Venkatesh recently made a comeback in his team's win against MI by 52 runs. "I cannot control what happens out there...I can only control my process and that is what I have been doing," added Venkatesh.

57.title: Bulldozer used to help conduct raid, arrest rape accused: UP to SC
57.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has submitted an affidavit to Supreme Court stating that a bulldozer was used to "help" conduct a raid on the house of two people accused of rape in Saharanpur and make arrests. The affidavit was in response to a petition over unlawful use of bulldozers on suspicion of crime. "Whatever action was taken...was necessary," the affidavit stated.

58.title: Deepika doesn't want same unpleasant path for me: Ranveer on work-life balance
58.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said his wife and actress Deepika Padukone shares the importance of a work-life balance with him, having realised the same herself. "Deepika...guides me because she has also been there. She doesn't want me to go down that same not so pleasant path," added Ranveer. "Deepika's the reason I am able to have this personal evolution," stated Ranveer.

59.title: Mizoram CM flags off inter-state 'Unity' bus service to Tripura
59.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga on Monday flagged off an inter-state bus service called 'Unity' from Aizawl to Behliangchhip town in Tripura. The bus would run from Aizawl every Monday and Thursday, and would return from Behliangchhip every Tuesday and Friday. According to officials, efforts are underway to launch transport services between Aizawl and Churachandpur in Manipur and Tahan in Myanmar.

60.title: 9 lakh Afghans lost their jobs since Taliban takeover: US body
60.article_body: At least 9 lakh Afghans lost their jobs since the Taliban came to power in Afghanistan following withdrawal of American forces, said US Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction (SIGAR). Women's participation in the workforce is expected to shrink by 21% by mid-2022, said a report. Notably, the Taliban recently mandated women to cover their bodies completely in public.

61.title: Very receptive and down to earth CM: Sidhu praises CM Bhagwant Mann
61.article_body: Calling his 50-minute meeting with Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann "very positive", Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Monday praised Mann, saying he is a "very down to earth CM". "I haven't met such a receptive CM. He was ready to listen," Sidhu said. Sidhu had earlier called Mann a "rubber doll", alleging his government was run by Delhi.

62.title: Won't tolerate delay in implementing budget programmes: Karnataka CM
62.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday warned government officials against any delay in budget implementation. "You're under my radar. My government will not tolerate any delay in implementing...budget programmes," Bommai said during a meeting of Chief Executive Officers of Zilla Panchayats. He further urged the officials to restore public faith in the government by implementing welfare schemes.

63.title: She doesn't need dad's approval: Sona on Aamir's daughter being trolled for bikini pics
63.article_body: Referring to Aamir Khan's daughter Ira getting trolled for being in bikini in front of his father on her birthday, singer Sona Mohapatra, who was present at Ira's birthday party, wrote on Instagram, "She's 25...A free thinking adult woman...Is exercising her choices." Sona added, "She doesn’t need her dad’s approval or yours...Buzz off...Shove your politics where the sun don't shine."

64.title: State-wise percentage of women who are able to refuse sex to husbands released by govt
64.article_body: Eighty-two per cent women in India can say no to their husband if they do not want to have sexual intercourse, according to government's National Family Health Survey 5. The percentage in Lakshadweep, Mizoram and Goa stands at 94.2%, 93.3% and 91.9% respectively. The percentage is the lowest in Ladakh at 60.9%, according to the government data.

65.title: Pak TV channels told not to air content against military, judiciary
65.article_body: The Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority (PEMRA) has warned TV channels to not air content which casts aspersions against the country's military and judiciary. "Airing such content violated PEMRA rules," it said, adding that the channels could face legal action in case of violation. This comes after the Pakistani military warned journalists against dragging it into political issues.

66.title: 10 flights cancelled at Chennai Airport amid rains, winds due to Cyclone Asani
66.article_body: At least 10 flights have been cancelled at Chennai Airport amid heavy rains and gusty winds due to Cyclone Asani. Chennai Airport Authority confirmed flights to Chennai from Hyderabad, Mumbai, Visakhapatnam and Jaipur have been cancelled. Meanwhile, IMD said severe cyclonic storm lay centred 300 km southeast of Kakinada and 330 km south-southeast of Visakhapatnam at 5.30 am on Tuesday.

67.title: BharatPe fires several employees, to claw back ex-founder's restricted shares
67.article_body: BharatPe on Tuesday said it has initiated an action to claw back restricted shares of its former founder following a governance review. Notably, in a statement, it added that a new code of conduct has been implemented in the company. BharatPe said that it has also terminated the services of several employees who were involved with blocked vendors.

68.title: UGC seeks report from Sharda University over exam question on Hindutva & fascism
68.article_body: The University Grants Commission has sought an action taken report from Sharda University, Greater Noida over an "objectionable" question asked by it in a Political Science examination on similarities between Hindutva and fascism. "Needless to say asking students such questions is against the spirit and ethos of our country which is known for its inclusivity and homogeneity," the UGC said.

69.title: Declare India as Hindu Rashtra, ban other religions: TMC’s Yashwant Sinha
69.article_body: TMC leader Yashwant Sinha on Monday said that a simple solution to all our problems today is to declare India as a "Hindu Rashtra" by amending the Constitution and banning all other religions. "Delete non-Hindu history, take revenge for past wrongs against Hindus by Buddhists, Jains, Muslims and Christians," Sinha added.

70.title: Supreme Court stays arrest of Noida CEO Ritu Maheshwari in contempt case
70.article_body: Supreme Court has stayed the arrest of Noida CEO and IAS officer Ritu Maheshwari in a contempt case. This comes after the Allahabad High Court issued a non-bailable warrant against her. The contempt plea was filed by two persons whose land was acquired in 1990 by the New Okhla Industrial Development Authority (NOIDA) but they were not given fair compensation.

71.title: Sony's Q4 operating profit more than doubles to $1.06 billion
71.article_body: Sony has reported that its fourth-quarter operating profit more than doubled to $1.06 billion, helped by strong performance in its gaming and network services business. Sony's profit for the three months to March 31 stood at $510 million a year earlier. For the current year, Sony forecast operating profit to fall to $8.8 billion from $9.2 billion.

72.title: Very tough for DC to make a comeback after their 91-run loss vs CSK: Kaif
72.article_body: Ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said it is "very difficult" for DC to make a comeback following their defeat against CSK by 91 runs. "Self-doubts creep in after such defeats. Fans will be really disappointed as they wouldn't have expected such an effort," added Kaif. "They are depending a lot on David Warner. It's...like when Warner scores, DC wins," stated Kaif.

73.title: Sports facilities, course for para athletes proposed at Mumbai University
73.article_body: Physical Education department of Mumbai University has submitted proposal to have sports facilities and curated course on fitness training for para athletes. Professor Dr Vasanthi Kadhiravan, head of department, said, "Sports...is...important aspect of lives of differently abled people...not only does it help them in keeping illnesses away...it...enhances motivation and sense of accomplishment."

74.title: Johnny Depp to star as French King Louis XV in Maiwenn's next film: Reports
74.article_body: Johnny Depp is set to feature as French King Louis XV in a film which will be directed by French actress-filmmaker Maiwenn, as per reports. Maiwenn, who'll also star in the film, will play a mistress of the king, Jeanne du Barry, who was beheaded during the French Revolution, according to Deadline. It'll reportedly go on floors on July 8.

75.title: Twitter will comply with EU content rules after takeover: Elon Musk
75.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Twitter will comply with European Union’s rules on content once his proposed takeover is completed. Musk met Thierry Breton, the EU’s Internal Market Commissioner on Monday for the same. The EU agreed on the Digital Services Act last month, which was aimed at urging technology platforms to better police their published content.

76.title: Wasn't happy with work I was doing, thought of quitting acting in 2019: Wamiqa
76.article_body: Wamiqa Gabbi, known for her performances in '83' and 'Mai', has said she was not happy with the kind of work she was doing earlier and even thought of quitting acting in 2019. She added that things have changed for her with shows like 'Grahan' and 'Mai'. "I'm glad that I'm working in the industry in this phase," Wamiqa said.

77.title: Look for traces of Lata ji's singing in every singer I introduce: Bhansali
77.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali said he grew up "hero-worshipping" late singer Lata Mangeshkar, adding he looks for traces of her singing in every singer he introduces while composing music. "When I discover some rare song of hers, I feel...richer than a diamond merchant," Bhansali had earlier stated. Bhansali termed his recent film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' as his most exhausting movie so far.

78.title: UP government to set up office in Mumbai for its own natives
78.article_body: Uttar Pradesh (UP) government is planning to open an office in Maharashtra's Mumbai to connect with its own natives who're living in the latter state, according to a statement. The decision will help make migrants aware of the possible investments in UP, a government spokesperson said. It will also help people return to UP during any crisis, the spokesperson added.

79.title: Actress Demi Moore shares pic with 'hugging saint' Mata Amritanandamayi Devi
79.article_body: Actress Demi Moore took to social media to share a picture with her daughters and Mata Amritanandamayi Devi, who is known as the hugging saint. "Wow...amazing I had a blessing from this lady she came to Dublin in Ireland. She’s amazing," a fan commented. "Mata Amritanandamayi is your spiritual leader?" wrote another user.

80.title: Gujarat govt to provide ₹100 cr aid to onion farmers
80.article_body: Gujarat government will provide financial assistance of ₹100 crore to onion farmers in the state, Agriculture Minister Raghavji Patel said on Monday. "One farmer can get an assistance of a maximum of 25,000 kilograms...it's an assistance of ₹50,000 per farmer," Patel said. "The...farmers had made representations...about the losses incurred due to the low selling prices of onion," he added.

81.title: Pune to get light rain on Tuesday and Wednesday: IMD
81.article_body: Pune is likely to witness some light intensity rainfall on Tuesday and Wednesday, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted. "There is moisture incursion from easterly winds...Partly cloudy sky conditions will develop from time to time, keeping the maximum temperatures slightly below normal over many areas in Maharashtra, including Pune and surrounding areas," an IMD official said.

82.title: Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma passes away aged 84
82.article_body: Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma has passed away due to cardiac arrest at the age of 84 in Mumbai. He had been suffering from kidney-related issues for the last six months and was on dialysis. He composed music with flute legend Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia for films such as Silsila, Lamhe and Chandni among others.

83.title: Former dictator's son Ferdinand Marcos Jr wins Philippine Presidential elections
83.article_body: Ferdinand Marcos Jr, son of former Philippines' dictator Ferdinand Marcos has won Philippine Presidential elections with 96% of the eligible ballots counted in an unofficial tally. Marcos Jr has more than 30 million votes, double that of his rival Leni Robredo. Marcos fled into exile in Hawaii with his family during a 1986 uprising that ended his father's 20-year rule.

84.title: Who is 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz, who defeated Nadal and Djokovic in same tournament?
84.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz, who defeated Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal and Alexander Zverev en route to his Madrid Open victory, was born in El Palmar in Spain on May 5, 2003. He's now the world number six men's tennis player. He turned pro in 2018 and has won five singles titles. He's the second-youngest player to win two ATP Masters 1000 titles.

85.title: Unable to celebrate 2-yr-old son's b'day, 35-yr-old B'luru woman kills self
85.article_body: A 35-year-old woman died by suicide in Bengaluru after she was allegedly unable to celebrate her two-year-old son's birthday. Reports said that she was already stressed about the financial condition of the family. Her husband, who was forced to shut down his business after losses, had asked the woman to hold off the celebration plans.

86.title: Rajasthan Royals becomes a Green Yodha: Schneider Electric
86.article_body: Energy automation company, Schneider Electric partners with Rajasthan Royals as their official sustainability partner. The collaboration aims to make cricket a sustainable sport. The team will play the IPL 2022 season's first carbon-neutral cricket match on May 11 as part of the Green Yodha sustainability initiative.

87.title: Punjab and Haryana HC stays BJP's Tajinder Singh Bagga's arrest till July 5
87.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court on Tuesday stayed the arrest of BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga till July 5. He was arrested by Punjab Police on Friday over his alleged threat to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Bagga was released from Punjab Police's custody and brought back to Delhi, following which a Mohali court had issued fresh warrants against him.

88.title: Tinder-owner sues Google to stop its app from exiting Play Store
88.article_body: Tinder-owner Match Group has sued Google on Monday, calling the action a "last resort" to prevent Tinder and its other apps from being removed from the Play Store for refusing to share up to 30% of their sales. "Like any business, we charge for our services, and like any responsible platform, we protect users against fraud," Google said.

89.title: Some suspects taken into custody: Police to Punjab CM Mann on Mohali blast
89.article_body: Punjab Police DGP Viresh Kumar Bhawra told Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann that some suspects in Mohali blast case have been taken into custody. CM Mann had earlier said that a probe was underway and that culprits will not be spared. Meanwhile, Punjab was put on high alert after the blast took place at the Police Intelligence headquarters on Monday.

90.title: GST inspector arrested while taking ₹2 lakh bribe in Gurugram
90.article_body: The Haryana State Vigilance Bureau on Monday arrested a GST inspector in Gurugram while accepting a bribe of ₹2 lakh. The officer had allegedly demanded a sum of ₹7 lakh from a building material supplier for issuing a GST number. Based on the supplier's complaint, a team of the vigilance bureau laid a trap and arrested the officer red-handed.

91.title: 284 geo-tagged CCTVs installed across Rachakonda Commissionerate
91.article_body: About 284 more geo-tagged CCTVs have been installed across Rachakonda Police Commissionerate in Hyderabad. The cameras, sponsored by the Telangana State Industrial Infrastructure Corporation (TSIIC), have been set up at main roads, below poverty line (BPL) colonies and other crime prone areas. The TSIIC had granted an amount of ₹3 crore for the installation of the cameras.

92.title: Demolition drive underway at Delhi's New Friends Colony, Mangolpuri; AAP MLA detained
92.article_body: An anti-encroachment drive to remove illegal structures is currently underway in Delhi's New Friends Colony and Mangolpuri amid heavy security arrangements, reported ANI. AAP MLA Mukesh Ahlawat reached Mangolpuri area and said they first need to prove that there is encroachment and bulldozers must be stooped. Ahlawat was detained by police, informed DCP, Outer District, Delhi Police Sameer Sharma.

93.title: We had our chance: Bumrah after loss to KKR by 52 runs
93.article_body: After registering his best-ever T20 figures against KKR on Monday, Mumbai Indians pacer Jasprit Bumrah has said that they had their "chance" after losing the game by 52 runs. "Always a good feeling to contribute but the important thing is for the team to win. We had our chance to do that but couldn't get it done," Bumrah said.

94.title: 18-yr-old woman kidnapped, raped while distributing her wedding cards in UP
94.article_body: An 18-year-old woman has alleged that she was kidnapped and raped by three men while she was distributing her wedding invitation cards in Uttar Pradesh. She also alleged that the accused took her to a political party leader, with whom she stayed for a few days before they forced her to stay with someone else in their village.

95.title: Love pop of green, pink; has nothing to do with Ranveer: Deepika on her clothes
95.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said she has come across as being partial to neutral colours but she loves "that pop of green or pink". "It has nothing to do...with Ranveer [Singh]," she said, adding, "I...will wear a classic black dress, I...will wear a neon green or fuchsia gown that can fit ten people in it and I...will wear a graceful saree."

96.title: 21-yr-old man molests landlady's 15-yr-old daughter in Pune; held
96.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested by Pune's Bhosari police after he allegedly molested the 15-year-old daughter of his landlady. The incident occurred when the accused went to give his rent agreement at the landlady's house and found that the minor girl was alone at home. The accused was booked under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act.

97.title: Imran Khan launches 'Raabta' app, asks youth to join his party
97.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan has launched an app called 'Raabta' that will allow people to apply for membership of his party, PTI. Khan urged the youth to join PTI using the application. He said that overseas citizens can also use the app. During the launch, Khan targeted PM Shehbaz Sharif saying that dynastic politics has returned.

98.title: 123 traffic signals to be shut daily for 3 hours in Ahmedabad
98.article_body: The traffic police in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Monday decided to shut down 123 traffic signals from 1 pm to 4 pm every day from Tuesday amid scorching heat. The decision has been taken to avoid discomfort for commuters waiting at the signal. The other 57 signals will remain active throughout the day, the traffic police added.

99.title: 2 inter-state human traffickers who ran brothel detained in Hyd
99.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police tweeted on Monday that they've detained two alleged inter-state human traffickers who hatched a plan to run a brothel house with three other associates in the district. The police said that girls were brought from West Bengal on the promise of jobs. Customers were charged ₹5,000, of which ₹2,000 was given to the victims, the police added.

100.title: Don't want fake encounters like UP: Raj CM over bid to arrest journalist
100.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said state government doesn't want "fake encounters like UP" to happen. His remarks came after Rajasthan police went to arrest journalist Aman Chopra despite a stay from HC in two of three cases filed against him. Chopra was booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by misinforming people about demolition of a temple in Alwar.

101.title: Agnihotri shares Sunanda's old tweets after Tharoor's 'Singapore bans Kashmir Files' tweet
101.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri shared Shashi Tharoor's late wife Sunanda Pushkar's old tweets after the Congress leader tweeted a report saying Kashmir Files has been banned in Singapore. "Is this true that Late Sunanda Pushkar was a Kashmiri Hindu? Is the enclosed SS true?" Agnihotri tweeted. "FYI, Singapore is most regressive censor in the world," he wrote.

102.title: Twitter has strong left-wing bias: Musk on tweet inciting violence against anti-abortionists
102.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Twitter "obviously" has a strong left-wing bias. Musk was responding to Mike Cernovich, a right-wing activist and conspiracy theorist, who highlighted that "a verified account is allowed to incite terrorism without any care in the world about being banned". Cernovich had shared a screenshot of a journalist's tweet encouraging violence against anti-abortionists.

103.title: Russian billionaire dies from suspected toad venom he used for treating hangover
103.article_body: A Russian billionaire and a former top executive of the Russian energy corporation Lukoil has died from suspected toad poisoning, reports said. Alexander Subbotin was reportedly injected with toad venom in order to treat a hangover, following which he suffered a heart attack and died. A shaman couple had suggested the oligarch use toad venom to treat hangovers.

104.title: Brazen attack on our police force deeply concerning: Amarinder Singh
104.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh reacted to the bomb blast incident at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali, saying that this brazen attack on the police force is deeply concerning. "Shocked to hear about the blast…Thankfully nobody was hurt," Singh tweeted. "I urge CM Bhagwant Mann to ensure perpetrators are brought to justice at the earliest," he added.

105.title: 2 journalists shot dead while sitting in car in Mexico
105.article_body: Two journalists were shot dead in Mexico's eastern state of Veracruz, said the authorities. Yessenia Mollinedo and Sheila Garcia were shot by unidentified gunmen while they were sitting in a car, according to local media. This comes four days after a veteran journalist, Luis Enrique Ramirez, was found dead on a highway in the Sinaloa state.

106.title: South Korea's new President starts work from underground bunker amid tensions
106.article_body: South Korea's new President Yoon Suk-yeol began his five-year term from an underground bunker set up at his new presidential office amid high tension on the Korean peninsula. Yoon was sworn-in as the President in a formal ceremony at Seoul's National Assembly. "I will faithfully perform the duties of the President," he said.

107.title: Gay dating app Grindr to go public in $2.1 billion SPAC deal
107.article_body: Gay dating app Grindr has said it will go public through a merger with a blank-check acquisition firm, a deal that values it at $2.1 billion. The app's existing shareholders would own 78% of the company after the merger. Singapore-based SPAC Tiga Acquisition will be merging with Grindr. Under the deal, Grindr will receive $284 million in cash from Tiga.

108.title: Mumbai airport to remain shut for 6 hours today due to maintenance, repair work
108.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) said that both the runways, RWY 14/32 and 09/27, will remain non-operational on Tuesday from 11 am to 5 pm due to pre-monsoon maintenance and repair work. "All operations will resume as usual post 5 pm," it added. The authorities have advised passengers to check the flight schedules to avoid any inconveniences.

109.title: Cash agent assaulted by thugs, robbed of ₹7 lakh in Noida
109.article_body: A cash collection agent was assaulted by unidentified bike-borne assailants in Noida on Monday. The victim, identified as Pramod Kumar Sahni, was robbed of ₹6.8 lakh by the assailants. According to the police, the accused were tailing Sahni before intercepting him near the Mahagun Mezzaria society which falls under Noida's Sector 113 police station.

110.title: Vijay Deverakonda to appear on Koffee with Karan 7: Reports
110.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda will reportedly make his 'Koffee with Karan' debut with the upcoming season of the talk show. "[He] has made it to...guestlist for Koffee with Karan 7. In most probability, he'll be appearing with Ananya Panday, his Liger co-star," reports said. "However, there were discussions on if Rashmika Mandanna might join him on...show instead of Ananya," reports further said.

111.title: Batters were poor, let us down; that's been our story: Rohit on loss vs KKR
111.article_body: Discussing MI's loss by 52 runs against KKR, MI captain Rohit Sharma said it was a "poor" performance with the bat, adding that the batters let the team down. "That has been the story for us," stated Rohit. "I am disappointed with the way we batted," he said. It was MI's ninth defeat in IPL 2022.

112.title: State agency destroyed archaeological remains around Puri temple: ASI to HC
112.article_body: Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) told Orissa High Court that state construction agency has destroyed archaeological remains around 12th century Jagannatha Temple in Puri. "At several locations...it is evident...removal of about 15-20 feet stratified deposit have taken place," ASI said, adding, "Odisha Bridge and Construction Corporation officials were...clueless about method of soil removal."

113.title: Far-reaching ramifications: Centre seeks time from SC on minority status for Hindus
113.article_body: The Centre has sought more time from Supreme Court to make up its mind on providing minority status for Hindus in states where their numbers are less than other communities. The government said the issue has "far-reaching ramifications" and needed more discussions with "state governments and other stakeholders". The government was replying to a plea by advocate Ashwini Kumar Upadhyay.

114.title: Cowardly act by those who want to disturb peace: Kejriwal on Mohali blast
114.article_body: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal condemned the bomb blast incident that took place at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali. "Mohali blast is a cowardly act of those who want to disturb the peace of Punjab. AAP’s Punjab government will not allow those people's wishes to be fulfilled," Kejriwal tweeted. "The culprits will be punished severely," he added.

115.title: US-based Grid Dynamics to setup India's 1st operational centre at Hyderabad
115.article_body: US-based Grid Dynamics, a digital transformation services and solutions firm, on Monday announced the setting up of its first operational centre in India at Hyderabad. "We're sure that the Hyderabad centre will exceed all its growth estimates," said Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao. The centre is expected to employ 1,000 engineers from the region by the end of 2022.

116.title: Man attacked for refusing to pay extortion money in Pune; 3 held
116.article_body: Three people have been arrested after a 43-year-old man, who runs a laundry in Pune's Narhe, was allegedly attacked by four persons with a sharp knife after he refused to pay extortion money. A search is on for the fourth accomplice. The police added that a 29-year-old man was also attacked while parking a vehicle in the Narhe area.

117.title: Spent 2-3 days in just a towel in hotel in Mumbai as airline lost my luggage: DC's Powell
117.article_body: DC batter Rovman Powell revealed he had to spend two-three days wearing just a towel in his hotel room when he landed in Mumbai as the airline lost his luggage. He added, "I was told the airline didn't have...my bags. The only thing I had with me was my hand baggage when I left airport...I didn't have any extra clothes."

118.title: Fire breaks out at diesel shed near Ludhiana railway station
118.article_body: A major fire broke out at the Northern Railways' diesel shed near Ludhiana railway station around 1:50 pm on Monday. The fire reportedly started after someone discarded a smoked cigarette near the waste engine oil and waste diesel filters at the shed. Though several waste service parts were gutted in the incident, no injuries or casualties were reported.

119.title: What are the best bowling figures in IPL history?
119.article_body: MI's Jasprit Bumrah on Monday recorded the fifth-best bowling figures in IPL history after registering figures of 4-1-10-5 against KKR. The best bowling figures were recorded by Alzarri Joseph in 2019, when he took six wickets for 12 runs for MI against SRH. Sohail Tanvir and Adam Zampa are other two bowlers to take six wickets in an IPL match.

120.title: 13-year-old Class 8 student found hanging from window in school in UP
120.article_body: The body of a 13-year-old boy, a Class 8 student, was found hanging with a scarf from the window at his school in Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur on Monday, police said. The student was not coming to the school for the last three days, the principal said. It was not known when he came to the school premises, the principal added.

121.title: Josh Talks raises $3.5 million, Paytm and OYO CEO invest too
121.article_body: Josh Talks has raised $3.5 million in a funding round led by Ankur Capital. Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma, Better Capital Founder Vaibhav Domkundwar, SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh and OYO CEO Ritesh Agarwal also participated in the funding. Founded in 2015, Josh Talks has showcased 3000 stories in 10 vernacular languages garnering as of October 2021.

122.title: Russia's ambassador drenched with red paint thrown by protestors in Poland
122.article_body: Russia's ambassador to Poland Sergey Andreev was drenched with red paint thrown by protestors as he arrived to honour Red Army troops who died during the Second World War. The ambassador was seen wiping away paint from his face in a video of the incident. The demonstrators carried Ukrainian flags and chanted "fascist".

123.title: Didn't feel awkward: Ranveer Brar on playing gay couple with Pratik Gandhi
123.article_body: Celebrity chef Ranveer Brar, who will be seen in 'Modern Love', said that it did not feel awkward to play a gay couple with actor Pratik Gandhi. "I think we had...met earlier...we had already reached a place where we didn't have to start from scratch. So, you know there was a certain level of comfort we had reached," he added.

124.title: Putin does not have a way out of Ukraine war: Biden
124.article_body: US President Joe Biden said that Russian President Vladimir Putin doesn't have a way out of the Ukraine war. He said that Putin "doesn't have a way out right now and I'm trying to figure out what we do about that". Biden added that Putin was wrong to believe that the war will break up NATO and the European Union.

125.title: When are you coming to deliver 1st Tesla?: Paytm CEO on Musk's Taj Mahal tweet
125.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to react to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's tweet on the Taj Mahal. Sharma tweeted, "It'll be an incredible challenge for Tesla to build FSD for India. We're known to be the most unruly road users. That said, when are you coming here to deliver the first Tesla here at the Taj?

126.title: Had goosebumps in many scenes, my throat dried up: Mahesh Babu on 'Major'
126.article_body: Mahesh Babu who is producing the upcoming film 'Major' said there were many sequences in the movie where he experienced goosebumps, adding that his throat dried up in the last 30 minutes. "After the film got over, I was quiet for two minutes," stated Mahesh. 'Major' is based on the life of National Security Guard (NSG) commando Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan.

127.title: Employee of engineering firm booked for corporate espionage in Ahmedabad
127.article_body: Ahmedabad Cyber Crime Cell has booked Rajnikant Patel, an employee of AIA Engineering Limited for alleged corporate espionage. He reportedly divulged secret Research and Development (R&D) material regarding the company's heat department to a rival company based in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur. Patel, who is part of AIA since 1994, had allegedly transferred confidential documents to his private e-mail.

128.title: 25-yr-old woman, minor daughter found dead in Tapi river in Gujarat
128.article_body: The bodies of a 25-year-old woman and her one-and-a-half-year-old daughter tied with a dupatta were found in Tapi river in Gujarat's Surat on Monday. Dipali Sagar Devey had left home on the afternoon of May 6 with her minor daughter without informing her husband. When they did not return home by the evening, Sagar filed a complaint with the police.

129.title: 6 people held for terrorising residents in Pune
129.article_body: Six people were arrested by the police for spreading terror in Pune. The gang members are accused of brandishing weapons and terrorising residents in the city's Chatuhshrungi and Samartha areas. According to the police, two of the six accused are juveniles while the others are identified as Shubham Khandagale (21), Vinayak Kapade (20), Yash Holekar (21) and Sainath Patole (21).

130.title: Female officer on the run with prisoner dies after car chase in US
130.article_body: A 56-year-old female jail officer, who tried to run off with a prisoner, allegedly shot and killed herself following a car chase in the US. Casey White, the 38-year-old prisoner who is a murder suspect, surrendered after the vehicle crashed during a police pursuit in Indiana. Vicky White, the officer, was taken to a hospital where she died.

131.title: Karnataka reports 90 new cases of COVID-19; 88 in Bengaluru alone
131.article_body: Karnataka on Monday reported 90 new cases of COVID-19, out of which 88 cases were reported from state capital, Bengaluru, alone. According to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), the city reported zero deaths due to COVID-19 on Monday, whereas 122 people recovered from the virus. The positivity rate in the city now stands at 1.4%, data showed.

132.title: Regular FIR to be filed against Raj minister's son on rape charges: Police
132.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday said that the process to turn the zero FIR into a regular one has begun against Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi's son, Rohit Joshi. This comes after a 23-year-old woman from Jaipur alleged that Joshi raped her on multiple occasions for over a year and also sexually assaulted her in a hotel in Delhi's Sadar Bazar.

133.title: Politicians should use decent language in public: HC in Lakhimpur case
133.article_body: Allahabad High Court has observed that politicians in high posts should use "decent language" in public "considering its repercussions" while hearing bail pleas in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. The court said this while referring to the Special Investigation Team's chargesheet, which concluded that the violence wouldn't have happened if Union Minister Ajay Mishra hadn't threatened farmers.

134.title: He was from Hindustan: Akshay on being asked if Prithviraj was from Guj or Raj
134.article_body: Akshay Kumar, during the trailer launch of 'Prithviraj', replied to a journalist who asked, "Where was Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan from - Gujarat or Rajasthan?" "He was from Hindustan...he was the son of Bharat Mata," Akshay said, adding, "Let's leave the question about where he was from...the most important thing is that he was from our country and that is enough."

135.title: Tesla halts production at China plant due to supply issues: Report
135.article_body: Tesla has halted production at its Shanghai plant due to issues with securing parts for its EVs, Reuters reported citing sources. Tesla's Shanghai plant produces the Model 3 sedan and Model Y crossover for the China market and for export. Tesla partially resumed production at the plant on April 19 following a 22-day closure caused by the city's COVID-19 lockdown.

136.title: Over 3 cr children between 12-14 yrs given 1st dose of COVID vaccine
136.article_body: Over three crore adolescents between the 12-14 age group have received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine so far, the Union Health Ministry said on Monday. COVID-19 vaccination for this age group was started on March 16, 2022. Similarly, the COVID-19 precaution dose administration for the age group 18-59 years began from April 10, 2022.

137.title: 12-year-old boy dies after consuming 'poisonous herb' in J&K, 3 hospitalised
137.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died while three kids were hospitalised after they consumed a poisonous herb in a forest near Rakhjaroh village in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district. The deceased, identified as Mohammad Basit, fell unconscious before being declared dead. However, the other three kids, identified as Shabnam (10), Sania (10) and Razia (8), have been referred to a Jammu-based hospital.

138.title: Bitcoin briefly drops below $30,000 for first time since July 2021
138.article_body: Bitcoin, in the early hours of Tuesday, fell below $30,000 for the first time since July 2021. Its value fell as low as $29,764 on Tuesday before recovering above $30,000. Bitcoin's value has more than halved from its all-time high which was close to $69,000 in November. The fall in cryptocurrencies followed a drop in US equities and other markets.

139.title: Lightspeed to invest in Razorpay's $75 mn secondary share sale
139.article_body: Lightspeed Venture Partners and Moore Strategic Ventures will pick up stakes in B2B payments platform Razorpay as part of a $75 million secondary share sale. Razorpay has offered to buy back stock options worth up to $75 million from 650 former and existing employees. This is Razorpay's fourth and biggest ESOP buyback since it started operations.

140.title: Whoever tried to spoil Punjab's atmosphere won't be spared: CM on Mohali blast
140.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann took to Twitter to say that police is probing the blast that took place at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali on Monday. "Whoever tried to spoil the atmosphere of Punjab will not be spared," he wrote on Twitter. Police had termed the blast "minor" and said investigation is underway.

141.title: India reports 2,288 new COVID-19 cases, a drop of 28.6% in daily cases
141.article_body: India has reported 2,288 COVID-19 cases, 3,044 recoveries and 10 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,207 COVID-19 cases and 29 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,637, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,103.

142.title: Holy moly! My husband is fire: Sanjana Ganesan after Bumrah takes 5 wickets
142.article_body: After MI fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah took five wickets for 10 runs against KKR in their IPL 2022 match on Monday, Bumrah's wife and presenter Sanjana Ganesan tweeted, "Holy moly! My husband is [fire]." "Your husband is the greatest bowler in the whole world, remember that," a fan tweeted. Bumrah has taken 10 wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

143.title: After Musk's Taj Mahal tweet, his mother says his grandparents flew there in 1954
143.article_body: After Elon Musk tweeted he visited Taj Mahal in 2007 and called it a "wonder of the world", his mother Maye Musk shared that his grandparents flew to the Taj Mahal from South Africa in 1954. She tweeted, "The only people to ever do this trip in a single-engine propeller plane, without a radio or GPS. Their motto 'Live dangerously...carefully'."

144.title: Mom raised me as single parent, so I take up all women-centric films: Rampal
144.article_body: Arjun Rampal, speaking at the song launch of 'Dhaakad' in Jaipur, said, "My mom raised me as a single parent. Whenever I get an offer for...woman-centric film, I take it up immediately." "This is my way of paying homage to my mother...I know how strong she was," he added. Directed by Razneesh Ghai, the action film also stars Kangana Ranaut.

145.title: Govt turned sedition law into propaganda machine: Cong’s Surjewala
145.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said the Centre turned the sedition law into a "personal propaganda machine" and sent lakhs of people behind the bars. "In eight years, the (PM) Modi government has charged nearly all journalists, independent commentators, educationists or political rivals with sedition law...We must expose the government and show its undemocratic nature," Surjewala added.

146.title: Jr NTR is the only hero who doesn't practice dance: Choreographer Sekhar
146.article_body: Choreographer Sekhar Master said 'RRR' actor Jr NTR is the "only hero" who does not practice dance moves, adding that he only needs one glance to perfectly imitate them. "Jr NTR doesn't even keep up with his dance strikes," stated Sekhar. "He does not need rehearsals," said Sekhar. Jr NTR's recent film 'RRR' also starred Ram Charan.

147.title: Marilyn Monroe painting sells for record-breaking ₹1,500 crore
147.article_body: A painting of Marilyn Monroe by Andy Warhol has been auctioned for $195 million (over ₹1,500 crore), making it the most expensive piece of 20th Century art ever sold. The painting, Shot Sage Blue Marilyn, was painted by Warhol in 1964. The amount is also the highest ever paid for an American work of art.

148.title: 2 sisters mistakenly marry each other's grooms after power failure in MP
148.article_body: Two sisters who were getting married on the same day in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain, accidentally married the wrong grooms due to a power failure. Since both the brides were in veils and wearing similar dresses, they happened to perform the wedding ceremony with the wrong grooms. The mix-up was realised after the grooms took the brides to their respective homes.

149.title: Shabana felt insecure with love he showered on me: Tanvi Azmi on father-in-law
149.article_body: Actress Tanvi Azmi said that actress and sister-in-law Shabana Azmi sometimes felt insecure when her father Kaifi Azmi showered love on Tanvi. "He used to call Shabana 'chiriya' and 'gulab ka phool'...Once he happened to tell me, 'You're my rose flower'...Shabana overheard that and all hell broke loose. She asked him, 'Abba, you called Tanvi a rose flower?'" she added.

150.title: Sedition law absolutely unnecessary in free country: Ex-Union Minister
150.article_body: Ex-Union Law Minister Ashwani Kumar said sedition law seems "absolutely unnecessary" in a free country. "We should support the repeal of this law or its comprehensive revising," Kumar added. "The kind of abuse (of the sedition law) we have seen in the last few months and years is unparalleled...What we have seen in last few months is unforgivable," he stated.

151.title: 54 detonators with low-intensity explosives found in bag at Nagpur Railway Station
151.article_body: A bag containing 54 detonators with low-intensity explosives was found in front of Nagpur Railway Station's main gate on Monday around 8 pm. Railway Protection Force (RPF) and Bomb Detection and Disposal Squads (BDDS) teams are investigating it, a railway official said. Detonators contained explosive content as good as a cracker, Nagpur Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar said.

152.title: Punjab on high alert after blast at Police Intelligence office in Mohali
152.article_body: Punjab was put on high alert on Monday night after a bomb blast took place at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali. The Punjab Police had termed the explosion "minor" and said that probe into the matter was underway. Meanwhile, pictures from the spot showed shattered doors and window panes.

153.title: Train derails near Vienna in Austria; 1 killed, several injured
153.article_body: At least one person was killed and several others were injured when a train derailed near Austria's Vienna on Monday, said the Red Cross. The incident occurred at around 6 pm local time, after which a team of rescue workers and four emergency helicopters were deployed to the scene. Two of the carriages were seen lying overturned on the ground.

154.title: Microsoft to help cover US employees' travel costs for abortion
154.article_body: Microsoft has said that it will cover travel costs for employees in the US who need to travel out of state for an abortion. The move comes after a recent draft leak from US Supreme Court proposed abolishing abortion rights nationwide. Several companies, including Yelp, Tesla and Amazon, among others have pledged to cover this cost for their American employees.

155.title: Drunk man urinates in front of neighbour's house in Delhi, killed in fight
155.article_body: A 44-year-old property dealer, Parveen Lamba, was killed in Delhi after he got into fight with his neighbour, Rahul Malhotra, after urinating in front of Rahul's house in drunk state in Delhi. Both parties threw stones at each other during fight. Malhotra and his father threw bottles at Lamba, one of which, hurt his leg and he started bleeding profusely.

156.title: US announces free internet plan for crores of low-income citizens
156.article_body: The US government has announced a programme under which free internet will be provided to crores of low-income citizens. President Joe Biden's administration said that 20 internet companies have agreed to provide discounted $30 monthly plans for 100 Mbps to 4.8 crore households. Combined with the government's $30 monthly internet subsidy, the service will be free for crores of people.

157.title: 6 people arrested with petrol bombs, lethal weapons in Bengaluru
157.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested six people belonging to two different gangs and seized petrol bombs, a country pistol and sharp-edged weapons from them. According to police, the gangs were planning to attack each other and create social unrest in the city. The accused had purchased 19 beer bottles and filled 10 bottles with petrol, DCP (East) Bheemashankar Guled said.

158.title: 38-year-old man beaten to death in road rage incident in Pune
158.article_body: A 38-year-old man was beaten to death by three persons on Lavasa Road in Pune in a road rage case, police said. The incident took place near Andgaon village on Sunday after one of the accused did not allow the victim and his cousin to pass. The deceased was on his way to meet his wife and children, police added.

159.title: Scaler’s Data Science program opens doors for non-coders
159.article_body: Scaler shares that its Data Science & Analytics program is here to equip users with data-driven business decision-making skills, regardless of coding experience. Experienced users can dive deeper into coding with the Machine Learning program to solve business problems at scale. It added that their Masterclass could be the entry point in someone's Data Science career.

160.title: CEO is also involved in team selections: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer on frequent changes
160.article_body: During the presentation ceremony after their victory against MI, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer revealed that the franchise CEO Venky Mysore is also involved in team selections. Iyer was answering a question on frequent changes to their playing XI. Iyer added that it is really difficult to tell players about axings. "Each and every player takes it well," he added.

161.title: Indian Railways introduces foldable 'baby berth' in Lucknow Mail, pics surface
161.article_body: Indian Railways' Northern Railway has introduced 'baby berth' in Lucknow Mail on Mother's Day. The Northern Railway Lucknow Division tweeted, "A baby berth has been introduced in Coach no 194129/ B4, berth no 12 & 60 in Lucknow Mail, to facilitate mothers travelling with their baby. Fitted baby seat is foldable about hinge and is secured with a stopper."

162.title: Played special music as Akshay walked from vanity to sets: Prithviraj director
162.article_body: 'Prithviraj' director Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi said that the team had recorded a special music track for actor Akshay Kumar. "We used to play that music for him when he would walk from his vanity van to the sets of Prithviraj. This was done so that he would leave behind present era and travel to the era of Prithviraj," he added.

163.title: Dangerous: Cyberabad Traffic Police on video of red light accident
163.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Monday shared a video of an accident caused due to vehicles jumping a red light and said that doing so "always" puts a person in "danger". The video shows a truck colliding with two vehicles that purportedly jumped the red light at a crossing. The traffic police also used the hashtags "#RoadSafetyCyberabad and #RoadSafety".

164.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as MI record their most losses in a season?
164.article_body: MI registered their most defeats in an IPL season after losing their ninth match in IPL 2022, against KKR on Monday. MI are last on the table with four points and a net run-rate of -0.894. KKR jumped to the seventh position with 10 points. DC, SRH and PBKS are the other teams having 10 points each.

165.title: Kieron Pollard accidentally hits umpire with the ball while bowling, video goes viral
165.article_body: MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard accidentally hit on-field umpire Chris Gaffaney with the ball while bowling during his team's match against KKR. While Pollard was about to bowl the fifth delivery in KKR's 10th over, the ball slipped out of his hands and hit the umpire. "When you're throwing chalk at your friend, but it hits the teacher," a user tweeted.

166.title: Journalist Danish who was killed in Afghanistan wins Pulitzer for covering COVID in India
166.article_body: Indian photojournalist Danish Siddiqui who was killed while covering the war in Afghanistan last year has been posthumously awarded a Pulitzer Prize along with Adnan Abidi, Sanna Irshad Mattoo, and Amit Dave for coverage of COVID-19 in India. In 2018, Siddiqui was awarded a Pulitzer Prize for coverage of the Rohingya crisis.

167.title: FIR against AAP MLA for 'obstructing' Shaheen Bagh demolition drive
167.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday filed an FIR against Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Amanatullah Khan for allegedly obstructing the anti-encroachment drive at Shaheen Bagh following a complaint by the South Delhi Municipal Corporation. "Khan and his supporters interfered in government duty at Shaheen Bagh," the police said. Protests erupted at Shaheen Bagh on Monday against the anti-encroachment drive.

168.title: Govt calls meeting with Uber, Ola amid rising consumer complaints
168.article_body: The Centre has called a meeting with cab aggregators Ola and Uber on Tuesday to discuss their policies after it received various complaints from consumers about their unfair trade practices, ride cancellation policy and surge pricing, among others. It will also seek information from them on how they calculate fares, cancellation charges and measures for consumer data protection.

169.title: Daddy showing who is the boss: Ravi Shastri on Bumrah's first-ever 5-wicket haul in IPL
169.article_body: After Jasprit Bumrah recorded his first-ever five-wicket haul in IPL, former India head coach Ravi Shastri tweeted, "Daddy showing who is the boss." He added, "Hope the young boys are watching. Class is permanent." Bumrah registered figures of 4-1-10-5 against KKR, the best figures by any bowler in IPL 2022.

170.title: Apna chashma badal: Suniel Shetty to Twitter user who wrongly tagged him for tobacco ad
170.article_body: Suniel Shetty responded to a Twitter user who wrongly called him out over advertising tobacco. Tagging various actors, the person wrote, "Your kids have to feel shame on you to lead nation in wrong way." Suniel replied, "Bhai tu apna chashma adjust kar le ya badal de (Brother, adjust your glasses or change them)." The person later apologised to him.

171.title: Experience a new era of cooling with Carrier air conditioners: Carrier
171.article_body: Carrier announced that as the inventor of modern air conditioning, it has kept in sync with evolving consumer demands for energy-efficient room air conditioners with advanced features. The 2022 range of air conditioners includes personalized cooling on a single click with Flexicool 6-in-1, faster cooling with Insta Cool and easy access to features with Carrier Smart Connect, the company stated.

172.title: Amit Shah launches sale of Khadi products in 107 CAPF canteens
172.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday launched the sale of khadi products in 107 Central Armed Police Force (CAPF) canteens. Shah, who's on a three-day tour of Assam, said khadi products will be made available in all paramilitary canteens across India soon. He had earlier made it mandatory for CAPF canteens to sell maximum "Swadeshi" products through Khadi and KVIC.

173.title: MP man fakes death after stealing ₹6.7 lakh, arrested after 9 months
173.article_body: A 34-year-old man, who allegedly faked his death to evade arrest in a theft case in MP's Chhatarpur district, has been caught after nine months. Sunil Namdeo had gone missing after collecting ₹6.65 lakh cash on behalf of a trader in July last year, police said. An unidentified body was later found which Namdeo's family identified as his.

174.title: Raj Police seize 1,300 kg silver & ₹56 lakh cash from bus, probe on
174.article_body: Police in Rajasthan's Dungarpur district on Sunday seized 1,321 kg of silver among other jewellery items along with ₹56 lakh in cash from a private bus while acting on a tip-off.
