The bus was going from Agra to Ahmedabad and the consignment had to be delivered at different places, police said, adding that the driver was unable to produce documents.

175.title: NCLT orders insolvency proceedings against Birla Tyres
175.article_body: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has ordered the initiation of insolvency proceedings against Birla Tyres in a case filed by multi-business chemicals firm SRF. As per SRF, Birla Tyres defaulted on payment of ₹15.84 crore for the supply of tyre cord fabric as of July 8, 2021. NCLT reprimanded Birla Tyres for taking a "casual attempt" to seek adjournments.

176.title: KKR keep their IPL 2022 playoffs hopes alive with 52-run victory against MI
176.article_body: KKR defeated MI by 52 runs in IPL 2022 on Monday to stay in the contention for a playoffs berth. With the win, KKR moved to the seventh spot from ninth spot on the points table. MI have now lost nine matches in the tournament. KKR will next face SRH on Saturday, while MI will next face CSK on Thursday.

177.title: Blast at Punjab Police Intelligence office in Mohali, pics showing damage surface
177.article_body: A blast was reported at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali late on Monday, officials said. Pictures released from the spot showed shattered doors and window panes. In a statement, the Punjab Police termed the explosion "minor", adding, "Senior officers are on the spot and an investigation is being done." A rocket-propelled grenade reportedly caused the blast.

178.title: Once a king, always a king: Harbhajan to Bumrah on his 5/10 vs KKR
178.article_body: Following MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah's five-wicket haul against KKR in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Once a king, always a king. What a phenomenal spell by Bumrah." S Badrinath took to Twitter and wrote, "Form is temporary, class is permanent. Boom boom performance." Bumrah posted bowling figures of 4-1-10-5 to help restrict KKR to 165/9 in 20 overs.

179.title: Delhi sees less than 1,000 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 4.94%
179.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 799 new cases of COVID-19 and three deaths. The positivity rate in the city was reported at 4.94% as compared to 5.34% reported on Sunday. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours dropped to 5,369 from 5,939 on Sunday. Delhi recorded 1,422 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday and 1,407 cases on Saturday.

180.title: Pak politician's 3rd wife aged 18 files for divorce 4 months after marriage
180.article_body: Pakistani politician Aamir Liaquat's third wife Syeda Dania Shah said she has filed for divorce from the 49-year-old, calling him 'worse than devil', the local media reported. Shah, who is 18 years old, married Liaquat in February 2022. She has alleged that Liaquat beat her after getting intoxicated, while Liaquat denied the accusations.

181.title: He's gone better and better: Hesson on Hasaranga after his 5/18 vs SRH
181.article_body: Praising Wanindu Hasaranga following his 5/18 in RCB's 67-run win against SRH in IPL 2022, RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said the spinner has gone better and better as the tournament has progressed. "He...sort of packs a punch, he usually gets himself a lot of ground...generates a lot of power and a lot of leverage," he added.

182.title: Parts of Mumbai face power outages due to technical fault at Tata Power station
182.article_body: Power outages were reported in parts of Mumbai, including Bandra, Khar and Dharavi, after a transmission line tripped on Monday. The electricity supply was snapped due to a technical fault at Tata Power's receiving station located in Dharavi, as per information reportedly received from the Maharashtra Energy Department. The latest outages were reportedly faced by consumers of Adani Electricity.

183.title: I saw the Taj Mahal in 2007, it's truly a wonder of the world: Elon Musk
183.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "It's amazing. I visited in 2007 and also saw the Taj Mahal, which truly is a wonder of the world." Musk was responding to a tweet that claimed to show a facade from a fort in Agra. Several Indian Twitter users responded to Musk's tweet, asking, "Any plans to visit India soon?"

184.title: French court reduces sentence of ex-PM Fillon in embezzlement case
184.article_body: A French appeals court on Monday cut a year off the five-year jail term given to former Prime Minister François Fillon for embezzling public funds. Upholding Fillon's conviction, the court changed the sentence to four years in jail, three of them suspended. Notably, Fillon's jail term was not enforced while his appeal was pending.

185.title: Rohit's shocked reaction after his controversial DRS dismissal goes viral, fans react
185.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma was declared out by third umpire after KKR opted for DRS for a caught behind. A video of Rohit's shocked reaction went viral on social media as the UltraEdge showed a spike even before the ball passed the bat. "IPL should also include HotSpot," a fan tweeted. "Very very poor umpiring this season," another wrote.

186.title: Russian missiles hit Odessa during European Council Prez's visit
186.article_body: European Council President Charles Michel on Monday made a surprise visit to Odessa, during which he was forced to take cover as Russian missiles hit the Ukrainian port city. Describing his visit, Michel tweeted, "I saw silos full of grain, wheat and corn ready for export." "This badly needed food is stranded because of the Russian war," he added.

187.title: Terrorist hideout busted in J&K's Poonch, ammunition found
187.article_body: J&K Police along with other security forces have busted a terrorist hideout in the Poonch district, officials said.  The hideout was found by the forces while carrying out a joint search operation in the forest area of Dera Ki Gali on Monday following information about suspicious movement in the area.  Around 100 assorted rounds of ammunition were recovered, officials added.

188.title: 18-year-old attacked with sticks & iron rods in Haryana, probe on
188.article_body: A class 12 student was allegedly attacked by a group of around 14 persons with sticks and iron rods while he was at his father's shop in Haryana's Hisar. The 18-year-old victim is currently undergoing treatment for his injuries. An FIR has been registered, police said, adding that the exact reason behind the incident is yet to be ascertained.

189.title: I think Bollywood can't afford me, I don't want to waste my time: Mahesh Babu
189.article_body: Telugu cinema star Mahesh Babu on Monday said, "I always wanted to do Telugu films and wished people across India would watch it. And now when that is happening, I'm very happy." He added, "I may sound arrogant...I did get a lot of offers in Hindi. But I think they can't afford me. I don't want to waste my time."

190.title: Somaiya family NGO got donations from firms on ED, CBI radar: Raut
190.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Monday said BJP leader Kirit Somaiya's Yuvak Pratishthan, an NGO run by his family, received donations worth crores from companies that were on ED, CBI, Income Tax department and SEBI's radar. "Is it a dirty game of turning black money to white?" Raut said. I will soon file complaint with investigative agencies, he added.

191.title: 98,000 quintals soybean worth ₹69 crore seized from MP factory
191.article_body: A joint investigation team of revenue and food departments seized 97,860 quintals of soybean worth over ₹69 crore from AV Agro Business Limited's factory in MP after conducting a surprise check. The action was taken as the company reportedly stocked soybean two-and-a-half times more than the prescribed limit. The seized stock was confiscated under provisions of the Essential Commodities Act.

192.title: 3 children drown while taking bath in Chambal river in MP's Morena
192.article_body: Three brothers, aged six, eight and 10, drowned while taking bath in the Chambal river in Madhya Pradesh's Morena district on Monday. The police were alerted by the family when the children failed to return for a long time following which a rescue operation was started. Their bodies were recovered later with the help of divers and locals.

193.title: Pope has postponed visit to Lebanon for health reasons: Minister
193.article_body: Pope Francis has postponed a planned visit to Lebanon that was scheduled for next month amid health concerns, Lebanese Minister Walid Nassar confirmed on Monday. Nassar added that a new date for the visit will be announced "as soon as it is determined". Pope Francis was recently spotted using a wheelchair in public owing to knee pain.

194.title: India beat Canada 5-0 to qualify for knockouts at 2022 Thomas Cup
194.article_body: India reached the knockout stage of 2022 Thomas Cup Finals after a 5-0 win against Canada in their Group C match in Bangkok on Monday. Notably, this is India's second successive win in the group. Ex-world number one Kidambi Srikanth gave India 1-0 lead followed by two doubles and two singles match wins. India will face Chinese Taipei on Wednesday.

195.title: Moderate to heavy rain, gusty winds likely in Bihar in next 2-3 days
195.article_body: Bihar is likely to witness moderate to heavy rain and gusty winds in the next two to three days as Cyclone Asani is intensifying in Odisha and Bengal, the Meteorological Centre said. North and south districts of Bihar may see heavy rain accompanied by thunderstorms. Parts of the state recorded light to moderate rain in the last 24 hours.

196.title: Pakistan imposes ban on export of sugar amid domestic demand
196.article_body: Pakistan has imposed a complete ban on the export of sugar owing to domestic demand for the commodity, PM Shehbaz Sharif said on Monday. "There will be...strict action against smuggling and hoarding [of sugar]. Absolutely zero tolerance [will be shown] for those found negligent in their duties," Sharif tweeted. Consumers in Pakistan's Punjab have reportedly complained of shortage of sugar.

197.title: LIC IPO shares to be allocated on May 12, listing on May 17
197.article_body: Bidders in LIC IPO will be allocated shares on May 12, Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey has said. He added that LIC will be listed on stock exchanges on May 17. The IPO, which opened on May 4 and closed on May 9, received 47.83 crore bids against 16.2 crore shares on offer.

198.title: Ancestral home of Lankan Prez Rajapaksa's family set on fire, video surfaces
198.article_body: The ancestral home of ex-Sri Lanka PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and his brother President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was set ablaze on Monday by anti-government protesters amid an economic crisis. Videos and pictures of the vandalised property in Hambantota were also shared online. Mahinda Rajapaksa resigned as PM today amid violent clashes and protests across the country.

199.title: 11 fishermen stranded in Odisha sea airlifted to safety following CM's order
199.article_body: Eleven fishermen, who were stranded in the Sonepur sea in Odisha's Ganjam district on Monday, were successfully airlifted and taken to their native places safely, following CM Naveen Patnaik's prompt direction. The fishermen were stranded in the sea when they ventured into the waters for fishing activities. The boat ferrying them had faced some technical glitches, as per reports.

200.title: Strict action against those found guilty of Bihar PSC paper leak: CM
200.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said that strict action will be taken against those found guilty of the Bihar Public Service Commission question paper leak. "The question paper leak of the BPSC examination is a matter of serious concern. I have asked senior officials to complete the probe at the earliest," said Kumar.

201.title: Manage economy, not media headlines: Rahul to PM as rupee plummets
201.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday asked PM Narendra Modi to focus on managing the economy not media headlines as the rupee slumped to an all-time low against the US dollar. PM Modi criticised former PM Manmohan Singh whenever the rupee fell, Rahul tweeted. The Indian rupee fell to an all-time low of 77.42 against the US dollar on Monday.

202.title: Mexico to hire 500 doctors from Cuba amid a shortage: Prez Obrador
202.article_body: During a visit to Cuba, Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador on Monday said that Mexico will hire 500 Cuban doctors as part of an effort to help make up for a shortage of medical professionals. Obrador met Cuban President Miguel Díaz-Canel and ex-President Raul Castro during the visit. Mexico will also purchase COVID-19 vaccines from Cuba, he added.

203.title: Imported EV cells may not be suitable for Indian conditions: NITI Aayog member
203.article_body: Battery cells imported for electric vehicles (EVs) may not be suitable for Indian conditions, NITI Aayog Member VK Saraswat said after multiple incidents of EVs catching fire were reported from across the country. "We should make sure that whatever cells we manufacture are suitable for Indian conditions of high temperature," Saraswat said. We must rigorously test imported cells, he added.

204.title: Next census to be e-census, will shape policies of next 25 yrs: Shah
204.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said that the next population census that will take place in the country will be an e-census "which will shape policies of the next 25 years". Shah further said that the names of citizens will be added to the electoral roll once they turn 18 and will be automatically deleted if someone dies.

205.title: Saudi Arabia aims to welcome 7 crore tourists this year: Official
205.article_body: Saudi Arabia aims to welcome over 7 crore tourists this year, a tourism official said on Monday. In recent years, the kingdom has started to promote leisure travel as part of a strategy aimed at diversifying the economy away from oil, according to Reuters. The country was visited by around 6.2 crore tourists in 2021.

206.title: U2's Bono, The Edge perform at bomb shelter in Ukraine's Kyiv
206.article_body: Irish band U2's members Bono and The Edge performed at a bomb shelter in Ukraine's Kyiv after being invited by President Volodymyr Zelenskyy amid the Russian invasion. The duo performed for 40 minutes at the Khreshchatyk metro station to show their solidarity to Ukraine. The performance was attended by about 100 people including members of Ukraine's armed forces in uniforms.

207.title: I want to keep on improving like Federer, Nadal, Djokovic: Alcaraz
207.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz, who recently won tour-leading fourth title of the year at Madrid Open, said he looks up to Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic as they don't stop improving. "I want to keep on progressing. I have really good shots...but I know that I can improve them and they can be even better," he added.

208.title: Most constructive time spent: Sidhu after meeting Punjab CM Mann
208.article_body: Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu reacted to his meeting with Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann calling it "most constructive 50 minutes spent", adding that Mann was "very receptive". "We spoke about law and order, financial emergency, drug problem and...nexus between drug smugglers and...police," he added. Notably, this comes days after AICC incharge of Punjab recommended disciplinary action against Sidhu.

209.title: AMU prof booked for dowry harassment, saying triple talaq on road
209.article_body: A case has been registered against an assistant professor at Aligarh Muslim University for dowry harassment and for pronouncing triple talaq on the road. He refused to allow her to pursue MTech and demanded ₹10 lakh as dowry, the woman said in her police complaint. The woman filed a case in court for domestic violence, dowry harassment on March 30.

210.title: 2, including toddler, burnt alive as car catches fire after collision in Rajasthan
210.article_body: Two people, including a toddler, were charred to death and two others of the same family suffered critical burn injuries after the car they were travelling in hit a culvert and caught fire in Rajasthan's Baran on Monday. The incident took place when the family was returning home in Kota after attending an engagement ceremony.

211.title: Russian satellite TV shows 'You've blood on your hands from Ukrainians' message
211.article_body: Russian satellite TV menus were altered to show viewers messages about the war in Ukraine, according to screenshots obtained by Reuters. "You have the blood of thousands of Ukrainians and hundreds of dead children on your hands," a slogan read. The incident took place on Victory Day, when Russia celebrated the 77th anniversary of Soviet Union's victory over Nazi Germany.

212.title: OTT is huge but hard to say if OTT actors are stars: Sudhanshu Pandey
212.article_body: Actor Sudhanshu Pandey has stated that there's no doubt OTT is huge and gives visibility to many actors who are now getting their due. However, it is hard to say whether OTT actors are becoming stars or not, he added. Sudhanshu further said that the television medium grew so much that TV stars are now as big as film stars.

213.title: Jasprit Bumrah records best bowling figures of IPL 2022
213.article_body: MI fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah on Monday recorded the best bowling figures of IPL 2022 so far. The 28-year-old registered figures of 4-1-10-5 against KKR. The previous best bowling figures in IPL 2022 were recorded by RCB leg-spinner Wanindu Hasaranga, who had taken five wickets for 18 runs against SRH. Bumrah has now taken 10 wickets in IPL 2022.

214.title: DGCA forms fact-finding team as differently-abled child barred from flight
214.article_body: A three-member team has been formed by the DGCA to conduct a fact-finding enquiry into the matter wherein IndiGo denied boarding to a differently-abled child at the Ranchi airport, officials said. The team will also go to Ranchi and Hyderabad for the investigations. "Based on the outcome of the said enquiry, further action shall entail," DGCA said.

215.title: Produce tickets, passports to reach airport: Sri Lankan Airlines amid curfew
215.article_body: Sri Lankan Airlines on Monday urged passengers to produce their tickets and passports at checkpoints to reach airport in Colombo after nationwide curfew was imposed earlier today. The government has also deployed army in Colombo after clashes between pro and anti-government protesters broke out in the city. At least two people died and 130 others were injured due to clashes.

216.title: Fire on 14th floor of building near Shah Rukh's 'Mannat' in Mumbai, pics surface
216.article_body: A level-2 fire has broken out on the 14th floor of a highrise building near actor Shah Rukh Khan's house 'Mannat' in Bandra's Bandstand in Mumbai. Eight fire tenders have reached the spot, officials said, adding that no casualties have been reported yet. The fire reportedly broke out at around 7.45 pm on Monday.

217.title: SpiceJet flight from Belgavi lands safely at Delhi airport after being hit by bird
217.article_body: A SpiceJet flight from Karnataka's Belgavi to Delhi, which was hit by a bird on Monday, later landed safely at Delhi airport. According to an airline official at Indira Gandhi International Airport, the Boeing 737-8 MAX aircraft had around 187 passengers onboard at the time of the incident. "The engine blade is damaged," SpiceJet's Duty Manager at the airport said.

218.title: Israel arrests 65-yr-old suspected of sending threats to PM's Family
218.article_body: A 65-year-old woman was arrested by the Israeli Police on Monday for allegedly sending death threats with bullets to the family of Israel's PM Naftali Bennett. The police only identified the woman as a resident of southern Israel and refused to reveal any further details under a court-issued gag order. The death threats were sent to the family last month.

219.title: Punjab CM offers ₹50 lakh to family of deceased COVID-19 warrior
219.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday directed the state Finance Department to pay ₹50 lakh compensation to COVID-19 warrior Manjit Singh's family. Singh, a PRTC bus driver, had died of heart attack while bringing back stranded pilgrims from Maharashtra's Hazur Sahib during the 2020 lockdown. Notably, AAP had sought ₹50 lakh compensation from the previous Congress government at the time.

220.title: Valuations are temporary, values are forever: OYO Founder
220.article_body: OYO Founder and Group CEO Ritesh Agarwal, while commenting on India crossing the 100-unicorn mark, tweeted, "Founders should remember that valuations are temporary, values are forever. Focus on doing good and stay grounded." He added that this "milestone" will lay the path for the next 1000 unicorns. "I'm bullish on Indian entrepreneurs taking the world by storm," Agarwal further wrote.

221.title: Family kills woman for dowry, tries to pass it off as suicide in UP
221.article_body: A 28-year-old woman was allegedly killed by her husband and in-laws for dowry in UP’s Muzaffarnagar, police said on Monday. She was found hanging in her room, but her brother stated that the accused killed the woman and then hung her body to pass it off as suicide, police added. Another accused is absconding, police further said.

222.title: Bangladesh extends repayment schedule of loans to Sri Lanka by 1 yr
222.article_body: Bangladesh has decided to extend the repayment schedule of loans given to Sri Lanka by one more year. Bangladesh had provided $200 million in loans to Sri Lanka under a currency swap facility in May last year. Notably, the loans were originally due to be repaid in three months, but the term was extended several times at Sri Lanka's request.

223.title: CBI books former staff member of TMC MLA Babul Supriyo in corruption case
223.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has booked a former staff member of TMC MLA and former Union Minister Babul Supriyo, along with top executives of Engineering Projects (India) Ltd, in an alleged corruption case. The CBI has alleged that Sushanta Mullick, who was Supriyo's employee, received ₹5 lakh in his account to favour a private company in December 2016.

224.title: UGC seeks report from university on 'Nazism & Hindu RW' exam question
224.article_body: The University Grants Commission (UGC) has sought a report from Greater Noida-based Sharda University on an exam question asking about similarities between Nazism and Hindu right-wing. "Asking students such a question is against the spirit and ethos of our country," UGC said. It asked the university to explain the steps taken by it to ensure such incidents don't happen again.

225.title: PFI is dangerous, should be banned soon: Assam Assembly Dy Speaker
225.article_body: Assam Legislative Assembly Deputy Speaker Numal Momin on Monday called the Popular Front of India (PFI) a "dangerous" organisation, demanding that it should be immediately banned. "[PFI's] planning towards Northeast, particularly Assam, is not very good," he added. Momin further stated that several people linked with the PFI were arrested during the anti-CAA protests in the state.

226.title: Toyota to invest ₹4,800 cr in Karnataka, will create 3,500 jobs
226.article_body: The Toyota Group has signed an MoU with the Karnataka government for a ₹4,800 crore investment in the state. As per the company's statement, the investment aims to promote green technology and set up local manufacturing facilities to build electric powertrain parts and components. The move will generate around 3,500 direct jobs, said Toyota Kirloskar Motor's Executive VP Vikram Gulati.

227.title: Sweden's ruling party to announce NATO membership stance on May 15
227.article_body: Sweden's ruling Social Democrats on Monday said that the party would announce on May 15 its position on whether the country should apply for a NATO membership. Notably, the Finnish ruling party, Social Democrats, are also expected to announce their position on Finland's NATO membership this week. Finland and Sweden are reconsidering their positions on joining NATO amid Russia-Ukraine conflict.

228.title: Rupee closes at all-time low of 77.50 against US dollar
228.article_body: The Indian rupee weakened further on Monday to close at a new all-time low of 77.50 against the US dollar, 60 paise over its previous close. During the trading session, the rupee touched its lifetime low of 77.52. The currency was weighed down by elevated crude oil prices and a widening trade deficit.

229.title: Nimrat Kaur shares pic of tattoo, says got it for mom with sister
229.article_body: Actress Nimrat Kaur shared a series of pictures on Instagram showing off her wrist tattoo on Sunday to mark Mother's Day. The actress wrote that she got the tattoo along with her sister Ruby five years ago to celebrate their bond with their mother. "The idea of an infinity knot symbolising Mama...protecting me and Ruby with her love," Nimrat wrote.

230.title: Singapore to ban 'The Kashmir Files', says 'it may disrupt religious harmony'
230.article_body: Singapore will ban the Hindi Bollywood movie 'The Kashmir Files' as it has been assessed to be "beyond" the city-state's film classification guidelines, authorities told Channel News Asia. It has been refused classification due to its "provocative and one-sided portrayal" of the 1990 Kashmiri Hindu exodus, they said. It has the "potential to...disrupt social...and religious harmony", they added.

231.title: KKR's management is to blame for their performances in IPL 2022: Kaif
231.article_body: Talking about KKR, who are currently placed ninth in the IPL 2022 standings, Mohammad Kaif said the KKR management is to blame for their current situation as they have done a lot of "chopping and changing". He added that too many changes added pressure on the players and it became difficult for them to play in that environment.

232.title: He's done right thing: Neetu on Ranbir not being on social media
232.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor has said that her son Ranbir Kapoor has done the right thing by not being on any social media platforms. Neetu further said that earlier fans had a craze for celebrities and their personal lives and the urge to see them onscreen was high. Now actors post regular updates and have become way more accessible, she added.

233.title: AAP govt in Punjab working undemocratically: Ex-Deputy CM of UP
233.article_body: The AAP government in Punjab is working in an "undemocratic manner" and "not following due legal process", former UP Deputy CM Dinesh Sharma said commenting on Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga's arrest last week. "Wherever there is the BJP government, work is being done in all areas for development, including education, health and security," he said.

234.title: Deeply distressed with rumour mongering: Axis AMC Founder CEO on alleged scam
234.article_body: Axis Asset Management Company (AMC) Founder CEO Rajiv Anand on Monday said he is deeply depressed with rumour mongering regarding allegations that two of fund managers (FMs) at Axis Mutual Fund have been removed from their positions for front-running. "If there is a problem, we will address it. Do not malign the reputations of the highly skilled professionals," Anand said.

235.title: LIC's public issue has been successful: DIPAM Secretary
235.article_body: Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Monday said the LIC's IPO offer "has met with tremendous success". The LIC IPO, which started on May 4, has been closed today after being oversubscribed 2.95 times. While the policyholder position has been subscribed 6.11 times, the employees portion has been subscribed 4.39 times.

236.title: Properties worth ₹67 cr belonging to gangster Vikas Dubey seized in UP
236.article_body: Over a dozen properties worth ₹67 crore belonging to gangster Vikas Dubey, killed in a police encounter in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur in July 2020, were attached on Monday. The properties were allegedly earned through illegal means. The properties were located in Kanpur, Kanpur Dehat and Lucknow, District Magistrate Neha Sharma said.

237.title: This young hero will become a superhero for MI: Irfan on Tilak Varma
237.article_body: Praising Tilak Varma, ex-India cricketer Harbhajan Singh said the MI batter is like an "investment" for the franchise. Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan lauded the 19-year-old batter, saying this "young hero will become a superhero" for MI if he continues to play like he's playing in the ongoing IPL. Tilak has scored 328 runs from 10 matches so far.

238.title: Humans will land on Mars within this decade: SpaceX President
238.article_body: SpaceX President and COO Gwynne Shotwell told CNBC that SpaceX will likely land humans on Mars before the end of the 2020s. "I think it'll be in this decade, yes. People on the moon, sooner," Shotwell said. She added, "We need to get a large delivery to the surface of Mars, and then people will start thinking harder about it."

239.title: Mobs set fire to Sri Lankan MP, minister's houses amid crisis; videos surface
239.article_body: Houses of members of Sri Lanka's ruling party were set on fire on Monday as violent protests erupted after PM Mahinda Rajapaksa stepped down amid the country's worst economic crisis. Videos showed the houses of MP Sanath Nishantha and minister Ramesh Pathirana engulfed by fires. This came after Rajapaksa supporters clashed with anti-government protesters, wounding hundreds.

240.title: Dileep's wife questioned by Kerala Police in actress abduction case
240.article_body: Malayalam actor Dileep's wife Kavya Madhavan was questioned by Kerala Police on Monday in connection with the Malayalam actress' abduction and assault case. Dileep is the co-accused in the case. Kavya is the only witness and was served a notice by the probe team to appear earlier. She had refused, saying it should be held at place which she wishes.

241.title: Punjab CM directs police force to launch major crackdown on drug peddlers
241.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday directed the state police force to launch a major crackdown on drug peddlers and tighten the noose around any political functionary interfering with its anti-drug campaign. He added that neither political persons nor officers would be spared, if found conniving with the drug mafia. "All of you should work fearlessly," Mann told police personnel.

242.title: UN agency chief resigns amid probe into investments
242.article_body: Grete Faremo, the Executive Director of the United Nations Office for Project Services (UNOPS), resigned from her post amid a probe into investments made by the UN agency. The resignation comes after a news report claimed the UNOPS made "a baffling series of financial decisions" that purportedly led to $25 million in losses. Faremo had led the UNOPS since 2014.

243.title: India's biggest IPO of LIC subscribed nearly 3 times on final day of bidding
243.article_body: LIC's IPO, India's biggest IPO which opened on May 4 and closed on May 9, was subscribed 2.95 times on Monday. Expected to raise ₹20,557 crore, the IPO received bids for 47.83 crore equity shares against the IPO size of 16.2 crore shares. The policyholders' portion was subscribed 6.11 times, employees bid 4.39 times and retail investors bid 1.99 times.

244.title: Pak to tour Sri Lanka for just 2 Tests, ODIs removed on SLC's request
244.article_body: Pakistan will play only a two-match Test series during their tour of Sri Lanka in the month of July-August as the three-match ODI series has been cancelled as per requests from Sri Lanka cricket board. Final dates are yet to be announced. While Test series is part of World Test Championship 2021-23, ODIs weren't included in World Cup Super League.

245.title: Cong has been good to all, time to repay that debt in full: Sonia at party meet
245.article_body: At a meeting of the Congress Working Committee on Monday, party chief Sonia Gandhi said, "Congress has been good to all, (it's) time to repay that debt in full." In an apparent reference to the dissident G-23 leaders in Congress, she said, "Self-criticism is needed in...but (it) shouldn't be done in a manner that self-confidence and morale are eroded."

246.title: Russian envoy doused with red paint by anti-war protesters in Poland
246.article_body: Russia's Ambassador to Poland Sergey Andreev was doused with red paint by people in Poland's Warsaw who were protesting against Ukraine's invasion on Monday. Protesters were seen carrying Ukraine's flag and chanting "fascists" in videos that surfaced online. Andreev was visiting a Soviet Military Cemetery to mark 77th anniversary of the end of World War 2 when he was attacked.

247.title: Andhra software engineer shoots colleague dead at her wedding venue, kills self
247.article_body: A software engineer killed his female colleague, who was about to get married, before shooting himself in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore district on Monday. Police said the duo was in a relationship for three years and the woman's family had rejected the accused's proposal to marry their daughter. The accused allegedly gatecrashed the wedding venue and shot the woman dead.

248.title: Neighbour throws acid on family sleeping on roof in UP's Agra, 4 injured
248.article_body: A man has been booked for allegedly injuring four family members by throwing acid on them when they were sleeping on the roof of their house in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. Prima facie, it seems to be an outcome of a family dispute, Agra SSP said. A few drops of acid were reportedly found on the accused neighbour's roof, he added.

249.title: Aayush Sharma refutes reports of grandfather's death, says 'he's fighting'
249.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma refuted reports of his politician grandfather Pandit Sukh Ram's death saying, "[He is] fighting back bravely." Sharma said, "In this testing time for our entire family, I kindly request everyone to pray for his well-being and refrain the media from paying heed to any false news." The ex-Telecom Minister was hospitalised following a brain stroke.

250.title: MI to bowl first against KKR; MI make 1 change, KKR make 5 changes
250.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against KKR in their IPL 2022 match on Monday. MI have made one change to their playing XI, with injured Suryakumar Yadav being replaced by Ramandeep Singh. Meanwhile, KKR have included Ajinkya Rahane, Venkatesh Iyer, Sheldon Jackson, Pat Cummins and Varun Chakaravarthy in their playing XI.

251.title: Unrealistic beauty standards, filters can be toxic: Paris Hilton
251.article_body: American media personality Paris Hilton has said that the unrealistic beauty standards and filters on social media "can be very toxic". "I can't imagine being 12, 13-years-old and seeing these beauty standards that are not real and using the filters all the time," Paris added. She further said that it's not really good for someone's mind at that age.

252.title: TN woman cooks on road as house demolished in anti-encroachment drive
252.article_body: A woman in Chennai started cooking food on the road after her house was demolished during an anti-encroachment drive. The woman said she has documents of her house and it was demolished without any information. "I started cooking here on the streets as I have nowhere to go," she added.

253.title: Man installs saffron flag at Chhattisgarh royal family's palace, arrested
253.article_body: A man was arrested on Monday for allegedly stealing a "traditional flag" from the palace of a royal family in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh and replacing it with a saffron one. The person confessed to the crime and claimed he was mentally unstable, police said. "It is possible that [the act] could be a political message," a member of the family said.

254.title: Bengaluru to host mega metaverse summit from May 14 to 15
254.article_body: Bengaluru will host a mega metaverse summit named 'NamasteyNFT Bengaluru 2022' from May 14 to 15 at the International Exhibition Centre. It is likely to host more than 300 artists and 20 speakers like Vineet Vohra, Fikret Dilek Uyar and Jassi Oberai. Over 10,000 participants from across the country are expected to take part in the event.

255.title: Education, health startups can be game changers for India: Prez
255.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind has said the foray of startups into the "unexplored territories" like education and health "can be the game changer" for India. "It can be a combination of job provider and revenue earner for our people," President Kovind said. He added, "The stories of various...start-ups...slated to be worth more than one billion have scripted new history."

256.title: Suryakumar Yadav ruled out of remaining IPL 2022 matches
256.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav has been ruled out of the remaining matches of IPL 2022 owing to a left forearm muscle injury. He had sustained the injury during MI's match against GT on May 6. Suryakumar played 8 matches for MI this season, scoring 303 runs at an average of 43.29, including three half centuries.

257.title: Firecracker explosion triggers fire near BJP leaders at Noida event
257.article_body: A firecracker exploded and triggered a small fire in a tent under which BJP leaders were seated on a stage during an event in Greater Noida, prompting the local police to launch a probe. The police had asked organisers not to burst firecrackers, but they didn't listen to them, said Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police (Greater Noida) Vishal Pandey.

258.title: Adani Airports raises $250 million for airports development
258.article_body: Adani Airports has raised $250 million funding from a consortium of Standard Chartered and Barclays Bank with an option to raise another $200 million. The funds raised will be used to scale up the airports business into "one of the largest airport platforms globally," a spokesperson said. Adani Airports manages airports in Mumbai, Ahmedabad, Lucknow, Mangaluru and Jaipur, among others.

259.title: I'm okay with going to hell: Musk after 'If I die under mysterious circumstances' tweet
259.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "I'm ok with going to hell, if that is indeed my destination, since the vast majority of all humans ever born will be there." Musk's tweet came hours after he tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya." Musk's tweets sparked speculation about whether he was receiving threats from Russia.

260.title: Japan will cease to exist, Venice dying due to very low birth rates: Musk
260.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk recently tweeted, "At the risk of stating the obvious, unless something changes to cause the birth rate to exceed the death rate, Japan will eventually cease to exist." He added, "This would be a great loss for the world." In another tweet, Musk said, "Venice is slowly dying due to very low birth rates."

261.title: Cong, AAP leaders blocked bulldozers in Shaheen Bagh: Delhi BJP chief
261.article_body: Congress and AAP leaders blocked bulldozers during the anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh on Monday, hindering government action, said Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta. In letters to Delhi Police and South Delhi Municipal Corporation Commissioners, Gupta said, "I request [the Commissioner] to take just action against [Congress and AAP] leaders for obstructing government work."

262.title: Dumper truck crashes into vehicles leading to oil spill in Thane, 1 injured
262.article_body: Two vehicles were hit by a dumper truck carrying debris on Majiwada Bridge in Thane on Monday. The accident led to an oil spill on the stretch. The driver of the dumper truck, who was trapped inside the vehicle, sustained minor injuries to his right leg. As per reports, he was rushed to a nearby hospital for treatment.

263.title: Russians will always remember India's role in defeating Nazis: Russian envoy
263.article_body: On the occasion of the 77th anniversary of the end of World War 2, Russian Ambassador to India Denis Alipov said, "Russians will always remember with gratitude the Indian contribution to the defeat of Nazi Germany." He added, "In 1941,1942 friendship societies were set up in India in support of USSR...Indian contingents were engaged in providing supplies to Red Army."

264.title: Local BJP leader shot dead over land dispute in Jharkhand
264.article_body: A local BJP leader was shot dead in his sleep in Jharkhand's Lohardaga district on Monday over a land dispute, police said. The deceased has been identified as Ratan Mahato, a BJP booth committee president. Two alleged assailants have been identified and a manhunt has been launched to arrest them, said officer-in-charge Anil Kumar.

265.title: Babar Azam is the best batter in world at the moment: Vettori
265.article_body: On being asked who is the best batter in the world right now, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said, "Babar Azam is the most in-form batter on the back of his series against Australia." Babar was the second highest run-getter in Australia-Pakistan ODI series behind Imam-ul-Haq. The Pakistan captain is currently ranked number one in ICC ODI and T20I rankings.

266.title: Kejriwal to visit poll-bound Guj on May 11, will hold rally in Rajkot
266.article_body: AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal will visit poll-bound Gujarat on May 11 and address a rally in Rajkot on same day, party said. This will be Kejriwal's second visit to Gujarat in two weeks as he held rally with a Bharatiya Tribal Party (BTP) leader in Bharuch on May 1. AAP will contest Gujarat Assembly polls in alliance with BTP.

267.title: Sri Lankan ruling party MP found dead amid clashes: Police
267.article_body: A lawmaker from Sri Lanka's ruling party was found dead on Monday following a clash with anti-government protesters outside the capital Colombo, the police said. Amarakeerthi Athukorala opened fire and critically wounded two people blocking his car in Nittambuwa, they added. Athukorala was found dead after trying to take refuge in a nearby building, they further said.

268.title: Kids don't care: Kunal on Taimur being trolled for refusing pics
268.article_body: Actor Kunal Kemmu has reacted to Saif Ali Khan's son Taimur being trolled for asking journalists to stop clicking his pictures, saying, "Kids don't care...they don't have to be diplomatic." Kunal further said, "But I think it's also the people who sit there wanting to comment on this, they need to change." Kunal is Saif's sister Soha Ali Khan's husband.

269.title: Delhi to witness fresh spell of heatwave for next 3 days: IMD
269.article_body: Delhi and its adjoining areas are likely to witness a fresh spell of a heatwave for the next three days, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Monday. The temperature may reach 43°C to 44°C on May 11 and 12. "The April like situation [of heatwave] will not be there in May," said a senior scientist of IMD.

270.title: Over 73% of work on Mumbai Metro Line 3 completed: MMRC
270.article_body: Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation (MMRC) said that over 73% of the work on Line 3 has been completed. Over 82% of the work on stations has also been completed, it added. "The project is running behind the schedule. I have made a catch-up plan to ensure that the project is completed...as per the revised timeline," Metropolitan Commissioner SVR Srinivas said.

271.title: Bulldozers will run at Delhi's New Friends Colony on Tuesday: SDMC
271.article_body: South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) Central Zone Chairman Rajpal on Monday said illegal encroachments will be removed in New Friends Colony from 11:00 am on Tuesday. "Bulldozers of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi will be running tomorrow as well," Rajpal said. This comes after SDMC's anti-encroachment drive in Shaheen Bagh was halted due to protests on Monday.

272.title: Maha MP Navneet Rana, husband to approach PM against ill-treatment in jail
272.article_body: Maharashtra MP Navneet Rana and her MLA husband Ravi Rana on Monday said they will approach PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah to raise the issue of their alleged ill-treatment by Maharashtra authorities when they were in jail recently. "We had filed a complaint against it here, but no action was taken," Navneet said.

273.title: Will file FIR against ‘popat’ Raut who said he'll bury me: Rana
273.article_body: Amravati MP Navneet Rana on Monday called Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut a 'popat' and said that she will file an FIR against him for threatening to bury her 20-feet deep. Navneet Rana on Sunday challenged Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to contest an election against her, adding that Lord Ram will teach Shiv Sena a lesson in civic polls.

274.title: Sky turns blood-red due to rare light phenomenon in China, pics surface
274.article_body: Pictures and videos from a Chinese city showed the sky taking on a blood-red hue due to a rare phenomenon. The sky in Zhoushan turned red on Saturday (May 7) causing panic, after which meteorological experts issued an explanation. The refraction and scattering of light from fishing boats due to more water in the atmosphere led to the colour change.

275.title: 'Prithviraj' educational film, should be shown in schools: Akshay
275.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking at the trailer launch of 'Prithviraj' on Monday, called it an educational film, adding that there's only a paragraph about the warrior in history books. The actor further requested the government to screen the film in schools as a mandatory event so children are told about Indian history. "I want every child to watch it," Akshay added.

276.title: U'khand CM Dhami files nomination papers for Champawat bypoll
276.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami filed his nomination papers on Monday for the upcoming Assembly bypoll for Champawat constituency. Dhami will face Congress leader Nirmala Gahtori in bypoll that is slated to be held on May 31. Ex-BJP MLA Kailash Chandra Gahtori vacated the seat for Dhami after latter lost to Congress' Bhuwan Kapri from Khatima in Uttarakhand Assembly polls.

277.title: Largest passenger elevator, as big as a room, installed at Mumbai's Jio World Centre
277.article_body: KONE Elevator India installed a 25.78 square metre elevator at Mumbai's Jio World Centre and claims that it's the world's largest passenger elevator. The 16-tonne elevator, supported by 18 pulleys and nine ropes for safety, is "as big as a room" and has a four-panel centre opening door and glass walls. It can reportedly carry 200 people at one time.

278.title: Patiala clash main conspirator Barjinder Parwana sent to 14-day judicial custody
278.article_body: The alleged mastermind and main conspirator behind the recent violent clashes in Punjab's Patiala, Barjinder Singh Parwana, has been remanded to a 14-day judicial custody . This comes days after clashes broke out between two groups during an anti-Khalistan protest by Shiv Sena. So far, six people have been arrested in connection with the case.

279.title: Indian women's team beat Canada in their Thomas and Uber Cup opener
279.article_body: Indian women's badminton team beat Canada 4-1 in their opener in Group D at Thomas and Uber Cup Finals in Bangkok on Sunday. Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu gave India 1-0 lead before Canada levelled it 1-1 following Shruti Mishra and Simran Singhi's loss in their doubles match. Later, India won their one doubles and two singles matches.

280.title: Twitter user asks question using 'Munna Bhai...' meme, Pune Police replies
280.article_body: Pune Police chief Amitabh Gupta held a question and answer session on Twitter on Monday. When a person asked him if it was necessary for a traffic police constable to take keys if one mistakenly jumps a signal, he replied, "Is it necessary to break the signal?." The Twitter user had used a meme from the movie 'Munna Bhai MBBS'.

281.title: Ukraine President Zelenskyy's fleece jacket sold for ₹86 lakh in London fundraiser
281.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's fleece jacket, signed by him, was auctioned for £90,000 (₹86,04,680) at a fundraiser for Ukraine in London. According to Ukraine's Embassy to the UK, the goal of the fundraiser, titled 'Brave Ukraine', was to "tell the stories of (Ukraine's) bravery which became iconic during the war, as well as to raise funds to support this bravery."

282.title: You don't need top education to build a company in India: Billionaire Watsa
282.article_body: Canadian billionaire businessman Prem Watsa said he's optimistic about India's startup industry as it's providing opportunity to the "common person". "[India] provides an opportunity...[to] someone who may not have gone to the best schools and universities but has the ability to build a company," Watsa stated. He added, "You got a 100 unicorns...and you'll have a ton more in India."

283.title: We begged them to not beat him up: MP lynching victim's daughter-in-law
283.article_body: Daughter-in-law of Dhansha who was killed on suspicion of cow slaughter a few days ago, said that she saw 20 men beating Dhansha up with sticks and rods. "He was first dragged out of his cot as he was sleeping. When we heard the noise, we came out of the house...We begged them to not beat him up," she added.

284.title: Bihar man gets life imprisonment for abducting, killing 6-yr-old step son
284.article_body: A session's court sentenced rigorous life imprisonment to a man for kidnapping and killing his six-year-old step son in Bihar's Bhabua. The court also imposed a penalty of ₹15,000 and an additional six months imprisonment if the accused failed to deposit the amount. The accused's wife was not staying with him as she was allegedly subjected to domestic violence.

285.title: No problem with action if he's wrong: Rajasthan minister on rape case against son
285.article_body: Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi, whose son Rohit Joshi has been accused of raping a 23-year-old woman over several months, has called for a strict probe into the matter and said he will "always stand with the truth and justice". "If my son has done anything wrong, I would not have any problem if action is taken against him," Mahesh added.

286.title: Over 70 injured after Sri Lankan Prez's supporters clash with protesters
286.article_body: At least 78 people were injured after clashes broke out between Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's supporters and anti-government protesters in Colombo on Monday, AFP reported. Police fired tear gas and water cannons to disperse the crowd, following which, an indefinite nationwide curfew was imposed in the country. Notably, Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa has tendered his resignation.

287.title: I hope Man Utd continue to stick with Ronaldo: Beckham
287.article_body: Amid calls for reforms at Manchester United ahead of the next season, former English footballer David Beckham hopes that the five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo remains in the club's plans. "It's important to him...we all know how much United means to him. He's still doing what he does best...so hopefully it continues for another year or two," Beckham said.

288.title: OYO to buy Direct Booker for ₹40 cr to expand footprint in Europe
288.article_body: OYO has agreed to buy Europe-based vacation rental firm Direct Booker for over ₹40 crore with the aim of expanding OYO's footprint in Europe, the company said in a statement. OYO added that it intends to "actively scout" for "tuck-in" acquisitions, especially in the European market. The firm already has nearly 9,000 homes on its Belvilla and Traum Ferienwohnungen platforms.

289.title: 17-year-old boy builds 'mind-controlled' robotic arm in US, pic surfaces
289.article_body: A 17-year-old from Virginia in the US has invented a robotic prosthetic arm that can be controlled by the mind. Benjamin Choi used his sister's 3-D printer and some fishing line to print individual parts of the arm and then bolted them all together. It uses an artificial intelligence (AI) algorithm to interpret the user's brain waves.

290.title: People taunted me for not getting pregnant, tried IVF: Sambhavna
290.article_body: Actress Sambhavna Seth has revealed that she has been taunted and age-shamed for not being able to get pregnant even after many years of marriage. Sambhavna and her husband Avinash Dwivedi got married in 2016. "IVF is one of the ways. Some people might know about it, some might not. We have tried it four times and failed," Sambhavna said.

291.title: 'KGF 2' screened in Seoul; first Kannada film to be showcased in South Korea
291.article_body: Yash starrer-'KGF: Chapter 2' had its screening in Seoul. It was the first Kannada film to be screened in South Korea along with its Hindi version. 'KGF: Chapter 2' was also the first Indian film to be screened post-pandemic. Several fans from India, Nepal, Bangladesh etc. attended the screening in large numbers. The action drama has received tremendous response worldwide.

292.title: 91-run win vs DC gives us lot of confidence: CSK all-rounder Moeen
292.article_body: After CSK's 91-run win over DC in IPL 2022, CSK all-rounder Moeen Ali said winning against a great side boosts the team's confidence going forward. "Any win at the moment is great for us," he added. Moeen posted bowling figures of 4-0-13-3. The defending champions are at the eighth spot on the points table with four wins in 11 matches.

293.title: 65-yr-old ex-Army man held for sexually assaulting 8-yr-old in WB
293.article_body: A 65-year-old ex-Army man was detained by police on Sunday for allegedly sexually assaulting an eight-year-old girl in West Bengal's Siliguri three months ago, an officer said. The matter came to light on Sunday as the girl's family members came to know about the alleged incident from her and a crowd gathered outside the home of the accused.

294.title: Pune Customs arrest woman for smuggling gold worth ₹26 lakh
294.article_body: Pune Customs officers arrested a 34-year-old woman passenger, who had flown in from Dubai for attempting to smuggle 500 grams of gold worth ₹26 lakh. The woman was trying to smuggle the gold in the form of crude bangles and chains, said a senior Customs officer. Police also arrested another woman who had come to receive her at the airport.

295.title: 6-yr-old boy finds megalodon shark tooth while looking for shells on UK beach
295.article_body: A six-year-old boy, Sammy Shelton found a three million-year-old megalodon shark tooth while looking for shells on a beach in the UK. The extinct megalodon was said to be 50 to 60 ft-long, three times the size of great white sharks. His father revealed that Sammy now sleeps with the tooth next to his bed.

296.title: Bus hangs from bridge after collision in Punjab; 2 dead, 17 injured
296.article_body: Two people were killed and about 17 others injured after a Haryana Roadways bus collided with a private bus in Punjab's Mohali, following which the former rammed into the railing and hung from a bridge. One of the deceased fell from the bus after the windshield broke as it hung from the bridge. The Haryana Roadways bus driver was booked.

297.title: Comedy is the nicest genre; it's difficult to make people laugh: Samantha
297.article_body: Actress Samantha Prabhu said that she wants to do more comedy films in the future. "The most difficult thing is to make people laugh. You can make people cry, you can make people sad, but to make people laugh is truly difficult and that is what I love doing," she added. "I feel comedy is the nicest genre," Samantha said.

298.title: I'm fortunate I got to work with Akshay sir: Manushi Chhillar on Prithviraj
298.article_body: When asked how it was working with Akshay Kumar in 'Prithviraj', former Miss World Manushi Chhillar said, "It's my first film so it'll always be special. I'm fortunate that I got to work with Akshay sir." "Yash Raj [Films] has launched me and [Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi] directed my first film. So definitely 'Prithviraj' is very special to me," she added.

299.title: Will always stand with truth: Raj Minister on rape allegations against son
299.article_body: Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi reacted to the allegations of rape against his son, Rohit Joshi, saying that he will always stand with truth and justice. "Police must conduct a strict and in-depth probe…Let the police do their work," Mahesh Joshi said. A 23-year-old woman from Jaipur alleged that Rohit raped her on multiple occasions over a year.

300.title: Actress Mohena Kumari Singh shares first glimpse of her newborn son
300.article_body: Actress-choreographer Mohena Kumari Singh took to Instagram on Sunday to share the first glimpse of her newborn son.  She also penned a poem for her son, which read, "Can't keep my joy at bay. Just happy to be a mum today. Having a celebration with my little one in 2022 on...8th of May and why not...it's my first Mother's Day."

301.title: I finished my work on 'Prithviraj' in just 42 days: Akshay Kumar
301.article_body: Akshay Kumar has revealed that he completed the shooting of his upcoming movie 'Prithviraj' in just 42 days. "Come on time and leave on time, then film completes on time," he added. "It was because of...pandemic that [it] got delayed, otherwise, [it] would've been released long back," said Akshay. 'Prithviraj' also stars Manushi Chhillar, Sonu Sood and Sanjay Dutt.

302.title: I was contemplating retiring out to get Dinesh Karthik in: Faf du Plessis
302.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis has revealed that he was contemplating retiring out against SRH to get Dinesh Karthik in. Talking about Dinesh Karthik scoring 30*(8), Du Plessis said, "If Karthik keeps hitting sixes like that, everyone always wants to get him in and bat for as long as possible...He’s just so clear."

303.title: Uber will treat hiring as a 'privilege' to cut costs: CEO
303.article_body: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi told employees in an e-mail that the company needs to cut costs, citing "the market is experiencing a seismic shift", CNBC reported. "We'll treat hiring as a privilege and be deliberate about when and where we add headcount," the CEO said. "We have to make sure our unit economics work before we go big," he added.

304.title: Pitch didn't suit pace bowling: Josh Hazlewood after win over SRH
304.article_body: After defeating SRH by 67 runs, RCB pacer Josh Hazlewood has said that the Wankhede Stadium's pitch didn't suit pace bowling. "The wicket probably got drier as the match went on. Being a day game, it deteriorated and we took the pace off. Our spinners bowled really well...Tonight's wicket didn't suit pace (bowling)," Hazlewood said.

305.title: Sometimes a break from the game is all you need: Vaughan on Kohli
305.article_body: Referring to Virat Kohli's form in the ongoing IPL season, former England captain Michael Vaughan said, "Sometimes a break from the game is all a player needs." He added, "The amount of cricket these players play, a break is as good as anything." Kohli has registered three golden ducks and has scored 216 runs in 12 games so far.

306.title: Instagram to support NFTs from Ethereum, Polygon, Solana: Report
306.article_body: Instagram is set to allow users to post and share their non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on the platform, CoinDesk reported. As per the report, Instagram is planning NFT integration with Ethereum, Polygon, Solana and Flow, which are the networks that host the majority of trading in NFTs. The pilot will reportedly feature a small group of US-based NFT enthusiasts.

307.title: Arjun Kapoor shares before-after pics showing his physical transformation
307.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram to share before-after pictures showing his physical transformation. He wrote, "15 months of being #workinprogress...I'm immensely proud of this journey. Feb 2021 to May 2022...it's been a tough one and I'm only glad that I could stay on track." He added, "I'm loving the state of mind...I'm in for these past 15 months."

308.title: Salman said I wasn't cut for B'wood, told me to try TV: Sidharth
308.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra has revealed that when he first met actor Salman Khan ahead of his debut, the former told him he wasn't cut out for Bollywood and should try his luck in TV. Sidharth made his debut in 2012 with 'Student of the Year'. Sidharth added Salman later said he made the comments to push him to do better.

309.title: BMC plans to build 'Democracy Square' near Azad Maidan in Mumbai
309.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) plans to build a 'Democracy Square' at a traffic island near Azad Maidan off MG Road in South Mumbai. The project will cost around ₹50,000 and will be funded by Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's local area development funds. "The idea was conceptualised by...CM and its aim is to honour our democracy," an official said.

310.title: Man hits elder brother with iron rod on head, kills him in Kerala; held
310.article_body: A 42-year-old man killed his elder brother by hitting him on the head with an iron rod in Kerala. Police said that the two used to fight regularly after getting drunk. Their wives did not stay with them because of this. The incident came to light when the locals went to check after hearing noises. The man has been arrested.

311.title: Woman killed, hung from tree on suspicion of witchcraft in Assam
311.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was allegedly killed and then hung from a tree on suspicion of practising witchcraft in the Kokrajhar district of Assam, police said. Three people have been arrested in connection with the incident and a search is on to nab another accused. Stab wounds were found on the body of the woman.

312.title: Paytm grants 39.7 lakh ESOPs to employees as its share price falls
312.article_body: Paytm-parent One97 Communications has granted 39.7 lakh new employee stock ownership plans (ESOPs) to its employees as Paytm's share price fell to one of its lowest levels since November. The exercise price of the new ESOPs has been set at ₹9 each. As per Paytm's stock price on Monday, the value of the ESOPs is estimated to be ₹220.7 crore.

313.title: Rename BPSC to 'state leak commission': Tejashwi Yadav
313.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has criticised the Bihar government over the recent leak of the Bihar Public Service Commission's question papers for civil services (preliminary) examinations. "The BPSC has been in a mess is no great news. But after yesterday's incident, nothing more remains to be said. It (BPSC) should be renamed to 'state leak commission'," Yadav said.

314.title: Yesterday, I went to bed at 5:20 am: Zverev after Madrid Open defeat
314.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev criticised the ATP Tour for its scheduling of late-night matches after he lost to 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz in the Madrid Open final in straight sets. "Two days ago, I went to bed at 4:30 am. Yesterday, I went to bed at 5:20 am," revealed Zverev, who had his semi-final against Stefanos Tsitsipas late Saturday night.

315.title: Massive fire as 15 cylinders explode in Nagpur; 100 hutments damaged, girl missing
315.article_body: More than 15 LPG cylinders exploded in a residential area in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Monday, leading to a massive fire in which nearly 100 hutments were damaged. A fire department official said no casualty was reported in the incident, but a minor girl was missing. The incident took place in the Beltarodi area where several labourers live.

316.title: Malavika Mohanan to star opposite Prabhas in thriller 'Raja Deluxe': Report
316.article_body: Malavika Mohanan has reportedly been roped in to play the female lead in an upcoming supernatural action thriller titled 'Raja Deluxe', which will also feature Prabhas. It'll be directed by Maruthi and produced by 'RRR' producer DVV Danayya, according to the report. "The team has...decided to start work on film from the month of August," Pinkvilla said quoting a source.

317.title: Took me a while to break it: Isha Koppikar on being typecast post Ishq Samundar
317.article_body: Isha Koppikar, who has been a part of several movies, spoke about how she was typecast after her songs 'Ishq Samundar' and 'Khallas'. "If I had known this earlier, I wouldn't have probably done [these songs]," she said. "It was 'Khallas' and it was backed by 'Ishq Samundar'...It took me quite a while to break that typecast," she added.

318.title: 2 dead as train collides with car crossing railway track in Assam
318.article_body: Two persons were killed after a passenger train collided with a car in Assam's Dhemaji district on Monday. The accident took place when the train was on its way to Tinsukia in Assam from Naharlagun in Arunachal Pradesh. The accident was reported from the Bordoloni-Dhemaji section of the district.

319.title: Pune cloth trader pays ₹3 lakh for new clothing, gets bags full of rags
319.article_body: A cloth trader from Pune, who paid ₹3 lakh to a supplier for new clothing, reportedly got bags full of rags. The trader said that a transporter delivered five stacks of clothes and upon opening them, he found that they contained old clothes. Police said that they have launched a probe based on transactions made with the supplier.

320.title: 5 including 4 of family die as car suffers tyre burst, collides with mini-bus in Guj
320.article_body: Four members of a family were among five killed after their car suffered a tyre burst, jumped the road divider and collided with a luxury mini-bus on National Highway 27 on the outskirts of Gujarat's Morbi. The family was returning home after attending a wedding ceremony in Kutch. CM Bhupendra Patel has also expressed sorrow over the loss of lives.

321.title: Married under pressure, T'gana woman along with lover kills husband after 36 days
321.article_body: Telangana Police have arrested six people after a woman killed her husband along with her lover and four others after 36 days of her marriage. Police said Shyamala (19) was in love with Shiva Kumar (20) for the last three years, however, under pressure from the elders she married Chandrasekhar (24). Earlier, she tried to poison her husband to death.

322.title: West will do everything to make sure Putin loses: Canada PM
322.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau has said the West will do everything possible to make sure that Russian President Vladimir Putin loses the war against Ukraine. "What Putin needs to understand is that the West is absolutely determined and resolved to stand against what he is doing," said Trudeau during a surprise visit to Ukraine where he met President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

323.title: 19-yr-old Alcaraz beats Zverev to win Madrid Open for 4th title of 2022
323.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz won his second ATP Masters 1000 title of 2022 after beating second-seeded Alexander Zverev 6-3, 6-1 at Madrid Open on Sunday. Overall, it was the 19-year-old's fourth title this season. Notably, Alcaraz became the youngest winner in Madrid and the second youngest to win two Masters 1000 titles since Rafael Nadal in 2005.

324.title: Rupee is in ICU under PM Modi: Cong after rupee hits all-time low
324.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala on Monday said the Indian rupee "is in ICU (intensive care unit)" under PM Narendra Modi's government after the rupee fell to an all-time low of ₹77.41 against the US dollar. Surjewala said rising inflation and depleting foreign reserves are causing the rupee to fall. "BJP-sponsored" communal tension is also responsible for the fall, he added.

325.title: Nepal to close its borders 3 days before local polls on May 13
325.article_body: Nepal government has decided to close country's border entry points with India and China 72 hours before local level elections, which are slated to be held on May 13. All movement across districts that share its borders with neighbouring countries will be restricted, except for emergency services, an official said. Domestic flight operations will also be halted on election day.

326.title: MCD carrying out demolition drive to disturb atmosphere: AAP MLA
326.article_body: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan joined the locals in their protest against the SDMC amid the ongoing anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh on Monday. "MCD is carrying out the drive to disturb the atmosphere," Khan added. "Why else have they come? If there is any encroachment in my constituency, tell me, and I will remove it," he stated.

327.title: Shooting, grenade attacks in Philippines amid elections; 3 dead
327.article_body: Incidents of shooting and grenade attacks have been reported in the Philippines' Maguindanao province amid the country's presidential election, which is being held on Monday. At least three people were killed after attackers in vans reportedly fired at a polling station in Buluan on election day. Furthermore, nine people were injured in grenade explosions in parts of Maguindanao on Sunday.

328.title: Rajkummar, Janhvi's 'Mr and Mrs Mahi' goes on floors in Mumbai
328.article_body: Rajkummar Rao and Janhvi Kapoor-starrer 'Mr & Mrs Mahi', backed by Karan Johar's Dharma Productions, went on floors in Mumbai on Monday. Karan took to Instagram Stories to share the news and wrote, "Best of luck to the entire team...for starting the first innings! Knock it out of the park." The cricket drama is being helmed by Sharan Sharma.

329.title: Noida Police arrests 3 for robbing people after meeting them on Tinder
329.article_body: Noida Police arrested two women and a man on Sunday for allegedly robbing and killing people after befriending them on dating apps, officers said. According to the police, the accused created fake profiles on Tinder and made friends with users. The accused would set up meetings, add sedatives in the victim's drinks and then escape with their belongings, police said.

330.title: 2 scrap dealers held for locking up policemen inside godown in Thane
330.article_body: Two scrap dealers were arrested for allegedly keeping two policemen captive inside their godown after the latter had come to inspect the premises of the dealers in Maharashtra's Thane district. The two policemen were looking for stolen rail tracks before allegedly being locked inside the godown by the two accused, identified as Shaukat Shaikh and Isaque Bhagwan, police said.

331.title: Man hurling Molotov cocktails near US police station shot dead
331.article_body: A man who was setting vehicles on fire by throwing Molotov cocktails outside a police station in the US was shot dead by officers. The police said they warned the man to stop but he refused, after which they opened fire. "The individual continued to throw multiple Molotov cocktails in the parking lot and eventually towards our officers," said police.

332.title: Won't let anyone annex Ukraine's victory over Nazism: Zelenskyy
332.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday marked Victory Day over Nazism in World War II and said, "We'll not allow anyone to annex this victory." He also named places in Ukraine which have been invaded by Russia, adding that Nazis were ousted from there. Furthermore, he said that these places "give us faith that we'll drive...occupiers from our land".

333.title: Sri Lanka PM Mahinda Rajapaksa resigns after state of emergency declared
333.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in the country, Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa on Monday resigned from the post. Earlier, Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa declared a state of emergency as the country is struggling with acute food and electricity shortages. A spokesperson had said that Gotabaya declared the state of emergency to "ensure public order".

334.title: Alyssa Healy, Keshav Maharaj named ICC Players of the Month for April
334.article_body: Australia wicketkeeper-batter Alyssa Healy and South Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj have been voted as the ICC Women’s and Men’s Players of the Month, respectively for April 2022. Healy won the award for her match-winning innings of 170 in the 2022 Women's World Cup final against England. Meanwhile, Maharaj won the award for taking 16 wickets in two Tests against Bangladesh.

335.title: Don't file such pleas, this is too much: SC on Shaheen demolition drive petition
335.article_body: The Supreme Court while rejecting CPI(M)'s plea challenging Delhi's Shaheen Bagh anti-encroachment drive, said, "What are the High Courts for?" It added, "Don't file petitions like this. This is too much...We've never given any licence to everybody to come here and say my house is being demolished even if it's unauthorised." It asked CPI(M) to approach Delhi High Court.

336.title: Happy to build partnership with Gaikwad: Conway after 91-run win over DC
336.article_body: After posting 110 runs opening partnership and helping his side win by 91 runs against DC, CSK opener Devon Conway has said that he is happy to "build the partnership" with opening partner Ruturaj Gaikwad. "The way he is playing eases my job. Being an all-format player is my brand," Conway said after scoring 87 runs off 49 balls.

337.title: Better if wins had come earlier in the season: Dhoni after CSK's 4th win
337.article_body: After CSK won their fourth match of IPL 2022 by defeating Delhi Capitals by 91 runs, skipper MS Dhoni said that it would have been "better" if wins had "come earlier" in the season. "The big-margin win helps...But this was a perfect game," Dhoni said. After losing seven matches, CSK is currently at the eighth position in the points table.

338.title: Railways hikes platform ticket price to ₹50 in Mumbai to curb crowds
338.article_body: The Central Railway has announced a temporary hike in platform ticket rates from ₹10 to ₹50 from May 9 to 23 at some stations in Mumbai. The move is aimed at reducing the crowds at the stations and also preventing misuse of alarm chains. The tickets rates have also been hiked in neighbouring Thane, Kalyan and Panvel.

339.title: Akshay only praised Kashmir Files as his film didn't work: Vivek
339.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri in an interview has stated that actor Akshay Kumar only praised his film 'The Kashmir Files' because his own film 'Bachchhan Paandey' didn't work at the box office. "What else can he say when 100 people stand and ask him about it? He was at a function in Bhopal so he had to praise it," Vivek added.

340.title: BJP to hold rally near Hyderabad on May 14, Amit Shah to attend
340.article_body: BJP's Telangana unit is planning to organise a rally at Tukkuguda, on the outskirts of Hyderabad, on May 14. "This public meeting will be attended by thousands of people and will show that...BJP is ready for the elections in the state," BJP leader Bandi Sanjay Kumar said. Senior party leaders, including Union Home Minister Amit Shah, will attend the rally.

341.title: I fully back every decision Pant takes on the field: Ponting
341.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting said he "fully backs every decision" that Rishabh Pant takes on the field during their matches. "It's easy to make judgments from outside but...when you're in the middle it's not an easy thing to do," he added. DC have lost six of their 11 games and are placed fifth on the IPL 2022 points table.

342.title: Will re-examine provisions of sedition law: Centre tells Supreme Court
342.article_body: The Centre on Monday told the Supreme Court that it "has decided to re-examine and reconsider" the provisions of the sedition law. Two days ago, the Centre had defended the sedition law saying that it is a valid law and that there are enough safeguards already in place to balance the constitutional rights of the citizens.

343.title: When I raised voice against forced conversion, I was threatened: Kaneria amid Afridi feud
343.article_body: Amid his feud with ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi, Danish Kaneria said that when he raised his voice against forced conversion, he was threatened that his career would be destroyed. After Afridi criticised Kaneria for giving an interview against him to an Indian channel, Kaneria tweeted, "India isn't our enemy...Our enemies are those who instigate people in...name of religion."

344.title: Broke down when daughter wasn't leaving ventilator: Mahi Vij
344.article_body: Television actress Mahi Vij in an interview has revealed that her daughter Tara was born premature and was not leaving the ventilator. The actress added she tried IVF for the first time in 2014 aged 32. "Tara was our last try...After that even if I was being given 100 injections I wouldn't feel the pain," Mahi said.

345.title: Mahesh Babu recalls losing his 'dear ones', says 'A lot changed in these 2 yrs'
345.article_body: During a speech at an event, actor Mahesh Babu recalled the hard times and loss of his dear ones in last two years. He said, "In these two years...so much...changed. I've lost some of my dearest ones." "But your love and support didn't change...I'll move forward bravely. On 12th May...'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' will release...it's a festival for...us," he added.

346.title: Akshay remembers mom at trailer launch of Prithviraj, says 'Wish she was here'
346.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar recently got teary-eyed at the trailer launch of his upcoming film, 'Prithviraj' as he remembered his late mother. He said, "I am very proud to be associated with the film and I wish my mother would've been around to see me playing this." He added that she would have been so proud of him.

347.title: It'll be huge dent in team's run-rate: Ponting on DC's 91-run loss vs CSK
347.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting said despite his side's 91-run loss against CSK in IPL 2022 putting a "huge dent" in their net run-rate, DC can still make play-offs with wins in all the remaining three matches. "Eight wins might be enough to get in...one big win might help our net run-rate," he added. They've won five matches so far.

348.title: Worked with diction coach for over a month: Ranveer on 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'
348.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that he worked with a diction coach for over a month while preparing for 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. "The way Jayeshbhai speaks is typical to those who hail from heartland Gujarat. I had to speak exactly how their Hindi would sound like...Divyang [director] ensured they [Gujarati artistes] were always around me on the sets," he added.

349.title: Man booked for circulating 19-yr-old girl's morphed pics in Ludhiana
349.article_body: A man was booked in Ludhiana for allegedly morphing a 19-year-old girl's pictures and circulating them on social media by creating her fake profile. "He had secretly captured a private moment between them and later uploaded the lewd pictures of the girl," a police official said. The accused purportedly circulated her printed photos in her locality to defame her.

350.title: Ready to make any sacrifice: Sri Lankan PM amid resignation reports
350.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa has said that he's "ready to make any sacrifice for...people", local media reported. This comes as the country faces its worst economic crisis. Rajapaksa said this after workers from SLPP party, to which he belongs, gathered at his residence urging him to not step down from his post amid reports of his offer to resign.

351.title: Reliance's shares decline 3% after Q4 results, fall 9.8% in 6 days
351.article_body: Reliance Industries Limited's (RIL) shares declined 3% to ₹2,542.10 in the early hours of trading on Monday after the company's January-March quarter results were declared.
