RIL's shares have fallen 9.82% since April 29. RIL reported a 22.5% YoY rise in net profit to ₹16,203 crore and a 35% YoY rise in consolidated revenue to ₹2.32 lakh crore in Q4 FY22.

352.title: Bulldozers return from Delhi's Shaheen Bagh after protesters block roads
352.article_body: Bulldozers sent by Delhi civic body for a demolition drive in Shaheen Bagh returned without any action after protesters turned up in hundreds to block roads and stop the machines. The South Delhi Municipal Corporation had sent bulldozers to carry out an anti-encroachment drive in the area. The Supreme Court has refused to hear a plea challenging the drive.

353.title: EU law regulating Apple, Google to come into effect in spring 2023
353.article_body: The European Union will begin enforcing the Digital Markets Act (DMA) in spring 2023, European Commission Executive Vice President Margrethe Vestager has stated. The antitrust law aims to curb the power of 'gatekeeper companies', including Meta, Google, Microsoft, Apple and Amazon. If found violating rules repeatedly, these entities could be fined up to 20% of their total global turnover.

354.title: SC rejects plea against Shaheen Bagh demolition drive, asks petitioner to move HC
354.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Monday refused to entertain the plea filed by the Communist Party of India (Marxist) against the anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh area. The SC further asked the petitioner to approach the Delhi High Court on the matter. The JCB bulldozer, brought in for the anti-encroachment drive in Shaheen Bagh, has now left the area.

355.title: Made best possible decision: IndiGo on barring differently-abled child from flight
355.article_body: IndiGo's CEO Ronojoy Dutta said the airline made "the best possible decision" by barring a differently-abled teenager and his family from boarding a Ranchi-Hyderabad flight. "At boarding area, the teenager was visibly in panic...the airport staff, in line with safety guidelines, were forced to make a difficult decision," Dutta said. IndiGo offered to purchase an electric wheelchair for the child.

356.title: New version of 'best pic' of a UFO ever taken released
356.article_body: A newer high-resolution version of a picture widely regarded as the 'best photograph' of a UFO ever taken has been released. The picture was originally taken by an automated camera used by the National Geographic Institute of Costa Rica over 50 years ago in 1971. A camera attached to a government mapping plane had captured the shiny round floating object.

357.title: 3 killed as speeding gas tanker hits 3 cars on Pune-Mumbai Expressway
357.article_body: Three people were killed and at least two others injured after a speeding gas tanker hit three cars as it turned on its side on Pune-Mumbai Expressway in Maharashtra's Raigad district on Monday. The tanker was going from Pune to Mumbai. Due to high speed, it crossed over to the opposite lane as the driver lost control of the vehicle.

358.title: Hyderabad Police nab man for IPL betting racket, seize ₹44,600
358.article_body: Police on Saturday apprehended a man at a bar in Hyderabad for allegedly participating in an IPL betting racket and seized ₹44,600 from his possession. The 36-year-old accused, identified as Gandam Srinivas, was nabbed while placing a bet on an ongoing match, police said. The accused would place his bets through an online application, police added.

359.title: Wicket had no bounce, so our batters looked to hit Umran: Hasaranga
359.article_body: RCB spinner Wanindu Hasaranga has revealed that their batters had planned to hit SRH pacer Umran Malik in their match on Sunday. "Umran...bowls back of the length balls, so...[on] this wicket where there was no bounce, [batters] were looking for him," said Hasaranga. Umran bowled two overs, conceding 20 runs in the first over and five in the second.

360.title: Was worried about being written off due to my South Indian accent: Deepika
360.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said that her South Indian accent was frowned upon and  that she was initially worried about being written off. "As an outsider to the industry, I inadvertently ended up becoming an observer...Earlier, I probably didn't have the confidence or the clout to be able to effect change, but the desire for it was always there," she added.

361.title: Pak's Sindh CM asks farmers to not grow rice due to water scarcity
361.article_body: Pakistan's Sindh Chief Minister Syed Murad Ali Shah has asked the farmers to not cultivate rice owing to the scarcity of water in the country. His comment came while talking to the media in Sehwan Sharif on Saturday. Expressing concern over unequal distribution of water, Shah said that it should be equally distributed throughout the country.

362.title: Mysterious metal object crashes through roof of house in Australia, pics surface
362.article_body: A mysterious metal object crashed through the roof of a house in the Australian city of Gympie. The family living in the house said that they heard a loud bang and saw smoke and debris everywhere. "We're not sure if it was space junk, because it's sharp, and it looks like it's come off something," the family said.

363.title: Zelenskyy awards medal to mine-sniffing dog who has found over 200 explosives
363.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has presented the mine sniffing dog, Patron, and his owner with a medal to recognise their service. The pint-size Jack Russell terrier has been credited with detecting over 200 explosives and preventing their detonation since the start of the war. Zelenskyy presented the award at a news conference in Kyiv with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.

364.title: Delhi man shot dead outside party after fight with drunk man brandishing pistol
364.article_body: A 38-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly shooting dead a 23-year-old man in Delhi. The victim was trying to leave a party when the accused allegedly followed him and shot him dead, police said. Police claimed the accused was drunk when he allegedly brandished his pistol and hurled slurs at the victim, when the men got into an altercation.

365.title: Residents protest against garbage depot on banks of Ramnadi in Pune
365.article_body: Residents of Bhugaon, Bavdhan and Bhukum areas in Pune district staged a human chain protest over an illegal waste management project along the flood lines of Ramnadi. Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil on behalf of the residents has requested Pune Municipal Corporation commissioner to conduct a meeting on May 9. The project was earlier rejected by standing committee, Patil said.

366.title: Bitcoin falls to the lowest level since January, trades below $34,000
366.article_body: Bitcoin fell on Monday to as low as $33,266 in morning trade, nearing January's low of $32,951 as slumping equity markets continued to hurt cryptocurrencies. It then steadied to trade above $33,600. According to BBC, the world's largest cryptocurrency has fallen by 50% since its peak in November 2021.

367.title: Job interest in Twitter rises over 250% after it accepts Musk's buyout deal
367.article_body: The interest in Twitter jobs on Glassdoor rose 263% in a week after Twitter accepted Elon Musk's $44 billion takeover bid. The data was shared on Twitter by Daniel Zhao, Glassdoor's lead data scientist. "Say what you will about Elon, he does have a large fanbase of people excited to work for him," Zhao tweeted.

368.title: NIA raids premises of Dawood Ibrahim's aides in Mumbai, 1 detained
368.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) conducted raids against associates of gangster Dawood Ibrahim at several locations in Mumbai on Monday. Reports said that the officers of the agency detained Salim Qureshi, an associate of gangster Chhota Shakeel. Some important documents were also seized. ANI reported NIA had earlier registered a case over drug peddlers being associated with Dawood.

369.title: Actor Faisal Shaikh to participate in 'Khatron...', says 'I'm ready for thrill'
369.article_body: Actor Faisal Shaikh aka Mr Faisu is all set to enter the stunt-based reality show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12', hosted by Rohit Shetty. Speaking about the show, Faisal said, "From being social media super-star to now participating in Khatron Ke Khiladi, the feeling itself is unfathomable." "I'm ready for the thrill, action and adventure that awaits this season," he added.

370.title: Mumbai doctor suffers cardiac arrest while trekking to Everest base camp in Nepal, dies
370.article_body: A 52-year-old woman doctor from Mumbai died while trekking to the base camp of Mount Everest in Nepal, her family member said. "Dr Pradnya Samant, a resident of Goregaon, died of cardiac arrest at the Everest base camp...There was no accident," he added. The family member had claimed that the deceased's last rites will be performed at Goregaon's Shivdham crematorium.

371.title: Fred Savage fired from Wonder Years after allegations of inappropriate conduct
371.article_body: Fred Savage has been dropped from the comedy series 'The Wonder Years' following multiple complaints of misconduct in his role as executive producer and director. "We were made aware of allegations of inappropriate conduct by Fred, and as is policy, an investigation was launched. Upon its completion, decision was made to terminate his employment," Wonder Years producer 20th Television said.

372.title: Putin likens action in Ukraine to fight against Nazis in WWII
372.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday equated its current action against Ukraine to Soviet forces' fight against the Nazi soldiers in World War II. He was addressing an event at Moscow's Red Square on the 77th anniversary of Victory Day, which marks Soviet's win over the Nazis. A minute of silence was observed to honour the fallen soldiers.

373.title: Need to get creative, come up with ways to change the momentum: Williamson
373.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson said they need to come up with ways to change the momentum after they suffered their fourth straight defeat in the ongoing IPL season. "I think earlier in the competition when there was assistance with the new ball, we were certainly very threatening, so [now] we need to go back to the drawing board," he added.

374.title: Military action in Ukraine necessary, Russia fighting for motherland: Putin on Victory Day
374.article_body: Addressing a parade in Moscow's Red Square, Russian President Vladimir Putin said intervention in Ukraine was necessary because the West was "preparing for the invasion of our land, including Crimea". Putin said, "You're fighting for your Motherland, its future." Russia marks May 9 as Victory Day to commemorate the Soviet Union's victory over Germany's Nazi forces in World War II.

375.title: YouTuber Emma Chamberlain wore Maharaja of Patiala's choker to Met Gala
375.article_body: YouTuber Emma Chamberlain wore a choker that belonged to Maharaja of Patiala Bhupinder Singh during her appearance at the Met Gala. Emma, who is the ambassador of Cartier, wore the choker that was made in 1928 after the Maharaja decided to turn his De Beers diamond into a choker. Called the Patiala Necklace, it has 2930 diamonds and Burmese rubies.

376.title: I couldn't be happier: Ayushmann Khurrana on Anek's trailer response
376.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana said he's happy about the way audiences have reacted to the trailer of his upcoming film 'Anek'. He said, "I've always hunted for clutter-breaking content and 'Anek' rests at the top of the pile for me." "I'm delighted with the response...It has struck a chord in the hearts of Indians and I couldn't be happier," he added.

377.title: Krushna breaks down over tiff with uncle Govinda during podcast, says 'I miss you a lot'
377.article_body: On being asked about the tiff between him and his uncle Govinda on the 'The Maniesh Paul Podcast', comedian Krushna Abhishek said, "Whenever I speak to...media...things are put together out of context." He broke down and said he misses his uncle "a lot". "I want my babies to play with him...I know he misses me a lot too," he added.

378.title: Man, aides booked for killing 25-yr-old man in Ambala over old enmity
378.article_body: Police booked a man and his associates for allegedly murdering a 25-year-old man in Ambala's Ahema village on Saturday night. The deceased's father, the complainant, stated that the accused forced the victim to consume alcohol before pushing him into the river. There has been an old enmity between the main accused and the complainant's family.

379.title: A simple 'forget me not' message: Kaif as Pujara hits 4 tons in 4 straight county matches
379.article_body: After Cheteshwar Pujara smashed four hundreds in four straight county matches, former India batter Mohammad Kaif tweeted, "What do great players do when out of India team? Knock the selectors' doors with 100s and 200s like Pujara." He added, "Away from IPL glamour, a simple 'forget me not' message." Pujara has scored 717 runs in the ongoing county season.

380.title: SC to hear petition against Shaheen Bagh demolition at 2 pm today
380.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear Communist Party of India (Marxist's) plea against Shaheen Bagh demolition at 2 pm on Monday. Court asked petitioner to provide copy of petition to Solicitor General. The apex court also asked the South Delhi administration why it began demolishing alleged encroachments at Shaheen Bagh when hearing was scheduled in the court on Monday.

381.title: MS Dhoni heard saying 'Well done, old man' to Dwayne Bravo on stump mic
381.article_body: CSK's 40-year-old captain MS Dhoni was heard saying 'Well done, old man' to 38-year-old all-rounder Dwayne Bravo after his fielding effort in DC's 17th over on Sunday. Bravo had made a diving effort to stop a single at the cover area. CSK went on to defeat DC by 91 runs, registering the biggest win of IPL 2022.

382.title: Defence services aspirants protest in Haryana over pending recruitment tests
382.article_body: Several youths staged protests in various parts of Haryana, asking government to conduct pending written tests for recruitment in wings of the armed forces. Aspirants alleged screening and physical tests were conducted about two years ago but written tests were deferred due to COVID-19 pandemic. A protestor said that due to delay, some aspirants have crossed their maximum age limit.

383.title: Jasprit Bumrah's form in IPL 2022 is not a concern at all: Ravi Shastri
383.article_body: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri has said MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah's form in the ongoing IPL season is "not a concern at all". "It's just that oppositions have played him differently. They don't want to give him wickets...there's no issue of ability whatsoever," added Shastri. Bumrah has picked five wickets in their 10 games so far in the ongoing IPL season.

384.title: Conducted drills near Taiwan between May 6 and May 8: Chinese army
384.article_body: Eastern Theatre Command of China's People's Liberation Army has said in a statement that it conducted naval and air force drills near Taiwan between May 6 and May 8. Last week, Taiwan said that 18 Chinese military aircraft entered its air defence zone. The Chinese army added that the drills were to "further test and improve the joint combat capability".

385.title: Marriage is working for him: CSK's Moeen Ali on Conway smashing 3 fifties in a row
385.article_body: Referring to his teammate Devon Conway smashing three straight fifties in IPL 2022, CSK all-rounder Moeen Ali said, "Obviously marriage is working for him. He is doing well ever since." Calling Devon a "brilliant player", Moeen added, "He is somebody who gets a lot of runs...he's got great shots." Conway had briefly left the bio-bubble for his marriage last month.

386.title: It's demand of time to make health accessible, affordable: Mandaviya
386.article_body: It is the demand of time to make health accessible and affordable, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on Monday in Delhi. "Whose responsibility it is to ensure health facilities for the people? State governments, central government and health workers force," Mandaviya added. "We are all stakeholders," he further stated.

387.title: Sahitya Akademi award-winning writer Nilotpal Mrinal booked for raping woman for 10 years
387.article_body: Delhi Police have booked Sahitya Akademi award-winning writer Nilotpal Mrinal for allegedly raping a 32-year-old woman for 10 years under the pretext of marriage. The woman is a UPSC aspirant who has been living in Delhi. The FIR stated that a police officer called up the woman's father and told him she is blackmailing Mrinal to extort money from him.

388.title: Technical glitch briefly disrupts Mumbai's local train service
388.article_body: Mumbai local trains were briefly disrupted in the early hours of Monday due to the breakdown of an overhead electrical wire. "Due to...breakdown between Dahisar-Borivali at 5:50 am all UP through trains are being diverted...UP fast locals delayed by 15 min," the Western Railway tweeted. Notably, the problem was rectified by 7:23 am, the Western Railway said.

389.title: CWC to meet today, days ahead of Udaipur 'chintan shivir'
389.article_body: The Congress Working Committee (CWC) is set to hold a meeting on Monday evening in Delhi days ahead of the 'chintan shivir' (brainstorming session) to be held in Rajasthan's Udaipur. Proposals from six panels formed on various issues will be discussed and finalised in the meeting, a party leader said. The three-day 'chintan shivir' will begin from May 13.

390.title: Cong workers sit in protest against demolition drive in Shaheen Bagh
390.article_body: Congress workers reportedly sat on roads protesting against the BJP-led MCD's anti-encroachment drive in Shaheen Bagh, Delhi. Several members even climbed atop a bulldozer before being detained by the police. The MCD is scheduled to run the drive with the assistance of the police force on Monday. Notably, the drive will cover Jasola Canal and Kalindi Kunj park as well.

391.title: Haryana IPS officer Hemant Kalson booked for abusing, misbehaving with nurse
391.article_body: Haryana-cadre IPS officer Hemant Kalson has been booked for allegedly abusing and misbehaving with a staff nurse at Panchkula's Civil Hospital. The nurse said that the officer, who held liquor bottle and gutka packet, had come to visit a female patient. She added that the officer shouted at the security guard and wanted to take the woman away.

392.title: Injected Rizwan with prohibited substance for recovery after asking ICC: Doctor on T20 WC
392.article_body: Pakistan cricket team doctor Najeebullah Soomro has revealed that Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan was injected with a prohibited substance for recovery after he developed a severe chest infection ahead of the T20 World Cup 2021 semi-final. Soomro said that doctors took prior permission from ICC. Rizwan spent two nights in ICU and went on to play the semi-final against Australia.

393.title: One day you'll become country's pride: 'Liger' maker on Deverakonda's b'day
393.article_body: 'Liger' director Puri Jagannadh has penned a note to wish actor Vijay Deverakonda on his birthday. "I saw the fire in your heart. I saw the fine actor inside you. I know what's running in your mind. Your hunger, your madness...your humbleness all these will take you to...places," he wrote, adding, "One day you'll become the country's pride. Happy Birthday."

394.title: 'Gau rakshaks' demand arms licences at Haryana mahapanchayat
394.article_body: Hindu groups such as VHP, Bajrang Dal and Gau Raksha Dal held a mahapanchayat in Haryana's Nuh district on Sunday, in which 'gau rakshaks' voiced several demands including arms licences. "Arms licences for 'gau rakshaks' should be given and FIRs against [them] should be withdrawn," demanded one of the organisers. Properties of cow smuggling-accused should be confiscated, he added.

395.title: Atal Bihari Vajpayee Stadium wall collapses month after inauguration in B'luru
395.article_body: As rains lashed several parts of Bengaluru, wall of newly constructed Atal Bihari Vajpayee stadium collapsed on Sunday. Reports said iron bars were seen scattered and the slabs were torn by heavy rain. The stadium that was built at a cost of ₹50 crore in HSR layout was inaugurated on March 1. Power supply was also interrupted in several places.

396.title: Salman Khan's lookalike shoots reel on UP road leading to a traffic jam; arrested
396.article_body: Azam Ansari, a lookalike of actor Salman Khan, was arrested by Lucknow police on allegations of disturbing the peace in public areas. He was taken into custody while he was recording a reel in the Thakurganj area. While a huge crowd gathered on the road to see his performance, it resulted in a traffic jam.

397.title: Saw a soldier in you: Parineeti to Priyanka over daughter's hospitalisation
397.article_body: As actress Priyanka Chopra shared an update about her daughter returning from the hospital after over 100 days, actress Parineeti Chopra said, "Mimi didi - I saw a soldier in the hospital - You. And little BD has taught us so much already and she doesn't even know it! Chalo now time to start spoiling her."

398.title: James Gunn wraps up 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3', shares pic with cast
398.article_body: Filmmaker James Gunn, in an Instagram post, announced the wrap of 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3'. He shared a picture in which he could be seen sitting next to the cast members of the Marvel movie, including Chris Pratt, Karen Gillan and Dave Bautista. "I love this...cast...I'm lucky...to have them on...journey with me for nearly a decade," James wrote.

399.title: 9% women, 38% men above 15 yrs use tobacco products: NFHS
399.article_body: Overall, 9% of women and 38% of men above 15 years of age use tobacco products, as per the National Family Health Survey 5 (2019-21). The NFHS-5 survey was conducted in an approximate 6.37 lakh sample households across 707 districts in 28 states and eight UTs. Tobacco use among men aged 15 and over is highest in Mizoram at 73%.

400.title: What did you get out of this?: Woman slaps accused who caused Indore building fire
400.article_body: The elder sister of the woman whose scooter was torched by the accused in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, slapped the latter in front of the police while asking him, "What did you get out of this?" He torched her sister's scooter after she rejected his marriage offer, causing a fire at a three-storey building in which seven people died.

401.title: Madhuri shares new pic with sisters, fan says 'Never seen them before'
401.article_body: Madhuri Dixit shared a new picture with her two sisters and their mother on the occasion of Mother's Day. Sharing the photo, Madhuri wrote, "All that I'm, all that I'll ever be, it'll be...your reflection Aai." The photo showed Madhuri and her sisters Roopa and Bharti in black outfits. Reacting to it, a user commented, "Never seen your sisters before."

402.title: Bodies of 3 men recovered from 2 areas in canal in Pune's Hadapsar
402.article_body: The bodies of three men were recovered from two different locations in a canal in Pune's Hadapsar on Sunday, the district's fire brigade said. Two of the bodies, recovered from near Shinde Vasti, were decomposed and might've died several days ago, an official said. The official added that prima facie, the third body, recovered from near Vaiduwadi, might've died recently.
